Type.Name: IMathTransform
Type.Description: Provides a simplified interface for manipulating transformation matrix data.

Example.Name: Get Patterned Cosmetic Thread Annotations Data
Get Patterned Cosmetic Thread Annotations Data
Get Patterned Cosmetic Thread Annotations Data

Type.Remarks:
RemarksTransformation matrix data: |a b c . n | |d e f . o | |g h i . p | |j k l . m | The SOLIDWORKS transformation matrix is stored as a homogeneous matrix of 16 elements, ordered as shown. The first 9 elements (a to i) are elements of a 3x3 rotational sub-matrix, the next 3 elements (j,k,l) define a translation vector, and the next 1 element (m) is a scaling factor. The last 3 elements (n,o,p) are unused in this context. The 3x3 rotational sub-matrix represents 3 axis sets:
row 1 for x-axis components of rotation row 2 for y-axis components of rotation row 3 for z-axis components of rotation The 3 axes are constrained to be orthogonal and unified so that they produce a pure rotational transformation. Reflections can also be added to these axes by setting the components to negative. The rotation sub-matrix coupled with the lower-left translation vector and the lower-right corner scaling factor creates an affine transformation, which is a transformation that preserves lines and parallelism; i.e., maps parallel lines to parallel lines. If the 3 axis sets of the 3x3 rotational sub-matrix are not orthogonal or unified, then they are automatically corrected according to the following rules:
If any axis is 0, or any two axes are parallel, or all axes are coplanar, then an identity matrix replaces the rotational sub-matrix.
All axes are corrected to be of unit length.
The axes are built to be orthogonal to each other in the prioritized order of Z, X, Y (X is orthogonal to Z, Y is orthogonal to Z and X).

Type.Name: IMirrorComponentFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a mirror component feature.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksBefore calling <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.CreateDefinition">IFeatureManager::CreateDefinition</see> to access this interface, you can pre-select the entities needed to create the mirror component feature:
To specify... Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> using selection Mark...
Mirror plane 1
Components to mirror 2
Alignment references 4 To create a basic Mirror Component feature, use at a minimum:
<see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.MirrorPlane">IMirrorComponentFeatureData::MirrorPlane</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.ComponentsToInstanceAlignToComponentOrigin">IMirrorComponentFeatureData::ComponentsToInstanceAlignToComponentOrigin</see> (Optional) <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.MirrorType">IMirrorComponentFeatureData::MirrorType</see> (if not explicitly set, defaults to <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swconst.swMirrorComponentMirrorType_e">swMirrorComponentMirrorType_e</see>.swMirrorType_CenterOfBoundingBox) (Optional) <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.ComponentOrientationsAlignToComponentOrigin">IMirrorComponentFeatureData::ComponentOrientationsAlignToComponentOrigin</see> (if not explicitly set, defaults to <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swconst.swMirrorComponentOrientation2_e">swMirrorComponentOrientation2_e</see>.swOrientation_MirroredX_MirroredY) To create a mirror instance as a copy of the component, positioned symmetrically about a plane in one of four orientations (for fully symmetric components, all four orientations are true mirrors), use:
MirrorPlane MirrorType ComponentOrientationsAlignToComponentOrigin <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.ComponentOrientationsAlignToSelection">ComponentOrientationsAlignToSelection</see> ComponentsToInstanceAlignToComponentOrigin <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.ComponentsToInstanceAlignToSelection">ComponentsToInstanceAlignToSelection</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.AlignmentReferences">AlignmentReferences</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.FlipDirections">FlipDirections</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.SyncFlexibleSubAssemblies">SyncFlexibleSubAssemblies</see> To create a new opposite-hand version of the component (a true mirror of a nonsymmetric component), positioned symmetrically about a plane, use:
MirrorPlane MirrorType <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.CreateDerivedConfigurations">CreateDerivedConfigurations</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.OppositeHandComponents">OppositeHandComponents</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.MirrorComponentsFolderLocation">MirrorComponentsFolderLocation</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.PlaceFilesInOneFolder">PlaceFilesInOneFolder</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.MirroredComponentFilenames">MirroredComponentFilenames</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.NameModifier">NameModifier</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.NameModifierType">NameModifierType</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.ReplaceFileLocations">ReplaceFileLocations</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.MirrorTransferOptions">MirrorTransferOptions</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.DimXpertScheme">DimXpertScheme</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.BreakLinksToOriginalPart">BreakLinksToOriginalPart</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.PreserveZAxis">PreserveZAxis</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMirrorComponentFeatureData.PropagateFromOriginalPart">PropagateFromOriginalPart</see>
After specifying this interface as needed, call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.CreateFeature">IFeatureManager::CreateFeature</see> to create the feature. This interface is analogous in functionality to the Mirror Components PropertyManager. See the following topics in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help for more information:
Comparing Types of Mirror Components Mirroring Components

Type.Name: IModelDoc2
Type.Description: Allows access to SOLIDWORKS documents: parts, assemblies, and drawings.

Example.Name: Get Names of Creators of Features

Type.Remarks:
RemarksThere are three main SOLIDWORKS document types:
parts
assemblies
drawings Each document type has its own object (<see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPartDoc">IPartDoc</see>, <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IAssemblyDoc">IAssemblyDoc</see>, and <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IDrawingDoc">IDrawingDoc</see>) with its own set of related functions. For example, the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IAssemblyDoc.AddComponent4">IAssemblyDoc::AddComponent4</see> method exists on the IAssemblyDoc object because adding components is specific to assembly documents. The SOLIDWORKS API also has functions that are common to all document types. For example, printing, saving, or determining the file name associated with a document would be common operations. To expose common document-level functions, the SOLIDWORKS API uses the IModelDoc2 object.

Type.Name: IMotionPlotAxisFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a plot's x- and y-axis feature data.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksTypical steps for creating a motion study's plot data and plot:
Open an assembly model and create the motion study. Select the model's entities whose motion you want to measure. Perform the calculations and get the results. Create a plot feature data. Create the plot's x-axis and y-axis feature data objects. Set the type of plot. Select the result component. Set the entities for the x-axis and y-axis feature data objects. Get the plot's x-axis and y-axis values and insert and display the plot. Examine the examples to see the calls for these steps.

Type.Remarks: RemarksThis interface is valid only if <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAnnotation.GetPMIType">IAnnotation::GetPMIType</see> returns <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swPMIType_e">swPMIType_e</see>.swPMIType_Datum.

Type.Name: IPMIDatumFeature
Type.Description: Allows access to a Product and Manufacturing Information (PMI) datum feature.
Type.Remarks: RemarksA PMI datum consists of a label in a square or round symbol. Leader and text are optional.

Type.Name: IPMIDatumTarget
Type.Description: Allows access to a Product and Manufacturing Information (PMI) datum target.
Type.Remarks: RemarksA PMI datum target consists of a target symbol and a target area.

Type.Name: IPMIDimensionData
Type.Description: Allows access to the Product and Manufacturing Information (PMI) for a dimension annotation in a STEP 242 model.
Type.Remarks: RemarksThis interface is valid only if <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAnnotation.GetPMIType">IAnnotation::GetPMIType</see> returns <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swPMIType_e">swPMIType_e</see>.swPMIType_Dimension.

Type.Name: IPMIDimensionItem
Type.Description: Allows access to a Product and Manufacturing Information (PMI) dimension item.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksThis API does not yet support the fit tolerance information typically associated with shafts in holes, such as classification, hole fit, and shaft fit. If <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPMIDimensionItem.TolType">IPMIDimensionItem::TolType</see> returns <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swTolType_e">swTolType_e</see>:
swTolFIT swTolFITTOLONLY swTolFITWITHTOL then no classfication, hole fit, or shaft fit data is available through this API.

Type.Name: IPMIFrameData
Type.Description: Allows access to a Product and Manufacturing Information (PMI) Gtol frame.

Type.Name: IPMIGtolBoxData
Type.Description: Allows access to a Product and Manufacturing Information (PMI) Gtol tolerance box.

Type.Name: IPMIGtolData
Type.Description: Allows access to the Product and Manufacturing Information (PMI) for a Gtol annotation in a STEP 242 model.
Type.Remarks: RemarksThis interface is valid only if <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAnnotation.GetPMIType">IAnnotation::GetPMIType</see> returns <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swPMIType_e">swPMIType_e</see>.swPMIType_GTol.

Type.Name: IPMIGtolFrameDatum
Type.Description: Allows access to a Product and Manufacturing Information (PMI) Gtol datum box.
Type.Remarks: RemarksThis interface allows you to access the primary, secondary, and tertiary frame datum.

Type.Name: IParagraphs
Type.Description: Allows access to paragraphs in note annotations.

Type.Name: IParallelMateFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a parallel mate feature.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksA parallel mate places selected items a constant distance apart. <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMateFeatureData">IMateFeatureData</see> is the parent of this mate interface. To create a parallel mate:
Follow general instructions in the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate">IAssemblyDoc::CreateMate</see> Remarks. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IParallelMateFeatureData.EntitiesToMate">IParallelMateFeatureData::EntitiesToMate</see> or use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> to pre-select the entities to mate using Mark = 1. Specify other properties of the ParallelMateFeatureData object. To edit a parallel mate:
Access its feature and call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetDefinition">IFeature::GetDefinition</see> to get the MateFeatureData object. Cast the MateFeatureData object to a ParallelMateFeatureData object. Modify the ParallelMateFeatureData object. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature::ModifyDefinition</see>. To delete this parallel mate, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2">IModelDocExtension::DeleteSelection2</see>.

Type.Name: IParameter
Type.Description: Allows you to get and set values in an attribute.

Example.Name: Add Attribute to Feature and Include in Library Feature
Add Attribute to Feature and Include in Library Feature
Add Attribute to Feature and Include in Library Feature

Type.Name: IPartDoc
Type.Description: Provides access to functions that perform operations on parts in part documents.

Example.Name: Create Imported Surface Body From Sketch

Type.Remarks:
RemarksThis interface provides functions that allow you to:
create bodies and features.
perform suppress operations.
obtain part extents and tessellation.
locate entities by name. The SOLIDWORKS API also has functions that are common to all document types. For example, determining the file name associated with a document would be a common operation. To expose common document-level functions, the SOLIDWORKS API uses the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDoc2">IModelDoc2</see> object. Events are implemented with delegates in the Microsoft .NET Framework. See the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks_namespace">Overview</see> topic for a list of delegates for this interface.

Type.Name: IPartExplodeStep
Type.Description: Allows access to the explode step of an explode view of a multibody part.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksThis interface is valid only for an active current explode view of a multibody part. To create an explode view of a multibody part, call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPartDoc.CreateExplodedView">IPartDoc::CreateExplodedView</see>. The setter properties and methods of this interface:
Always clear selection lists. Do not work if the Explode PropertyManager is open. Do not work if any body is being edited in the context of the multibody part. To edit an explode step:
Use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPartDoc.ShowExploded">IPartDoc::ShowExploded</see> to activate the explode view of interest. Use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPartDoc.GetExplodedViewConfigurationName">IPartDoc::GetExplodedViewConfigurationName</see> to get the configuration for the explode view. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IConfiguration.GetPartExplodeStep">IConfiguration::GetPartExplodeStep</see> to access the explode step of interest. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> to select:
Bodies to move with Mark = 1. An explode direction entity (cylindrical <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFace2">face</see>, conical face, linear <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IEdge">edge</see>, or <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IRefAxis">axis</see>) with Mark = 2. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISelectionMgr.GetSelectedObject6">ISelectionMgr::GetSelectedObject6</see> to get the bodies selected in step 4a. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPartExplodeStep.SetBodies">IPartExplodeStep::SetBodies</see>, passing in the bodies gotten in step 4a. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPartExplodeStep.SetExplodeDirection">IPartExplodeStep::SetExplodeDirection</see>, passing in the explode direction entity that was selected in step 4b. See Notes. Modify other explode step properties. Notes: When editing the object entity for the explode direction, please bear in mind:
If... Then...
Both object and manipulator index are valid Both object and manipulator index are set.
Manipulator index is valid, but object is invalid Manipulator index is set, and object is unchanged.
Object is valid, but manipulator index is invalid
Object is set, and the manipulator index is reset to the Z direction index.
Both object and manipulator index are invalid No values change. For more information, see Exploded Views in Multibody Parts topic in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help. To access explode steps of explode views of assemblies, see <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IExplodeStep">IExplodeStep</see>.

Type.Remarks: RemarksUse <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetErrorCode2">IFeature.GetErrorCode2</see> after creating the partial edge fillet feature to see if anything is wrong with the new feature. For more information, see the Partial Edge Parameters section of the Constant Size Fillets topic in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help.

Type.Name: IPerpendicularMateFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a perpendicular mate feature.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksA perpendicular mate places selected items at a 90⁰ angle. <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMateFeatureData">IMateFeatureData</see> is the parent of this mate interface. To create a perpendicular mate:
Follow general instructions in the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate">IAssemblyDoc::CreateMate</see> Remarks. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPerpendicularMateFeatureData.EntitiesToMate">IPerpendicularMateFeatureData::EntitiesToMate</see> or use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> to pre-select the entities to mate using Mark = 1. Specify other properties of the PerpendicularMateFeatureData object. To edit a perpendicular mate:
Access its feature and call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetDefinition">IFeature::GetDefinition</see> to get the MateFeatureData object. Cast the MateFeatureData object to a PerpendicularMateFeatureData object. Modify the PerpendicularMateFeatureData object. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature::ModifyDefinition</see>. To delete this perpendicular mate, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2">IModelDocExtension::DeleteSelection2</see>.

Type.Description: Allows access to a Physical Simulation motion study's properties.

Type.Name: IProfileCenterMateFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to profile center mate feature data.

Example.Name: Create and Edit Profile Center Mate
Create and Edit Profile Center Mate

Type.Remarks:
Remarks A profile center mate centrally aligns rectangular and circular profiles to each other and fully defines the components. <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMateFeatureData">IMateFeatureData</see> is the parent of this advanced mate interface. To create a profile center mate:
Follow general instructions in the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate">IAssemblyDoc::CreateMate</see> Remarks. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IProfileCenterMateFeatureData.EntitiesToMate">IProfileCenterMateFeatureData::EntitiesToMate</see> or use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> to pre-select the entities using Mark = 1. Specify other properties of the ProfileCenterMateFeatureData object. To edit a profile center mate:
Access its feature and call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetDefinition">IFeature::GetDefinition</see> to get the MateFeatureData object. Cast the MateFeatureData object to a ProfileCenterMateFeatureData object. Modify the ProfileCenterMateFeatureData object. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature::ModifyDefinition</see>. To delete a profile center mate, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2">IModelDocExtension::DeleteSelection2</see>.

Type.Name: IProfileGroupFolder
Type.Description: Allows access to a structure system profile group folder.
Type.Remarks: RemarksSee the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemFolder">IStructureSystemFolder</see> Remarks.

Type.Name: IProjectionArrow
Type.Description: Allows access to a projection arrow.

Type.Name: IProjectionCurveFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a projection curve feature.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksTo create a projection curve feature:
Use <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> to pre-select the necessary entities using the following Marks:
target faces on which to project a sketch = 1
sketch to project = 2
target sketch on which to project a sketch = 4
projection direction entity = 8 Call IFeatureManager::CreateDefinition(swFmRefCurve) to access this interface. Set non-entity properties on this interface. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.CreateFeature">IFeatureManager::CreateFeature</see> to create the projection curve feature. See the SOLIDWORKS Help for more information about projection curve features.

Type.Name: IPropertyManagerPage2
Type.Description: Provides add-in applications the ability to display and use views that have the look and feel of SOLIDWORKS PropertyManager pages.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksOK and Cancel buttons are optional for IPropertyManagerPage2 objects, but a Help button is always displayed. If you do not want to implement help for your add-in, return false on help notification to display SOLIDWORKS Help. PropertyManager controls are displayed in a single, left-aligned column. Slight vertical spacing adjustment is available with the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPageGroup.AddControl">IPropertyManagerPageGroup::AddControl</see> or <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPageGroup.IAddControl">IPropertyManagerPageGroup::IAddControl</see> or the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPage2.AddControl">PropertyManagerPage2::AddControl</see> or <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPage2.IAddControl">IPropertyManagerPage2::IAddControl</see> Options argument. Use <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.GetUserPreferenceInteger">IModelDocExtension::GetUserPreferenceInteger</see>(swPropertyManagerColorDivider,UserPrefOption) to get the color of the PropertyManager divider box backgrounds for custom bitmap color blending purposes. The returned integer value is the COLORREF value. The add-in application must implement the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swpublished.IPropertyManagerPage2Handler8">IPropertyManagerPage2Handler8</see> interface for data to be exchanged with the add-in application. The add-in application owns the IPropertyManagerPage2 object, which owns the IPropertyManagerPage2Handler8 for that page. The limits on the number of controls on a PropertyManager page are:
Total number of controls = 300 (This number does not include group and selection boxes.)
Total number of group boxes = 20
Total number of selection boxes = 15 NOTE: Number boxes count as 2 controls. All other controls count as 1 control. SOLIDWORKS does not allow suppressing components or features while a PropertyManager page is open. See <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/Using_PropertyManagerPage2_and_the_Related_Objects.htm">Using PropertyManagerPage2 and the Related Objects</see> for more information.

Type.Name: IPropertyManagerPage2Handler9
Type.Description: Must be implemented by the add-in application to handle callbacks from <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPage2">IPropertyManagerPage2</see>.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksTo use this interface:
In a SOLIDWORKS VBA macro, you must reference the SOLIDWORKS exposed type libraries for add-in use type library specific to the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.VersionHistory">version of SOLIDWORKS</see> that you are running. In a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# add-in, you must reference the SOLIDWORKS.interop.swpublished assembly and set ComVisibleAttribute to true (see <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros.htm">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET or C# Macros and Add-ins</see>). For all unimplemented methods of this object, the add-in application can return E_NOTIMPL.

Type.Remarks: RemarksBitmaps are 256 colors. The standard bitmap buttons are 23 pixels wide x 23 pixels high; however, you can make them larger. See <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/Using_PropertyManagerPage2_and_the_Related_Objects.htm">Using PropertyManagerPage2 and the Related Objects</see> for more information.

Type.Name: IPropertyManagerPageButton
Type.Description: Allows you to access a <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPage2">PropertyManager page</see> button control.
Type.Remarks: RemarksUsers can resize PropertyManager pages horizontally in SOLIDWORKS 2006 and later. This change in functionality affects the appearance of the buttons on PropertyManager pages created in SOLIDWORKS 2005 and earlier. In SOLIDWORKS 2005 and earlier, buttons remained aligned vertically at an indented position when a user resized a PropertyManager page. In most instances, these buttons are now centered when a user resizes a PropertyManager page. However, if a button on a PropertyManager page was aligned at the very left edge of the page and it was the only button on that line, then it is assumed that it was intentionally placed at that position and it will stay at that position if a user resizes the page. Any text on the button will also be left justified inside the button. If a button has a bitmap as its label, then the button remains next to the label instead of being centered. See <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/Using_PropertyManagerPage2_and_the_Related_Objects.htm">Using PropertyManagerPage2 and the Related Objects</see> for more information.

Type.Name: IPropertyManagerPageListbox
Type.Description: Allows you to access a <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPage2">PropertyManager page</see> list box control.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksImplement the event handler <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swpublished.IPropertyManagerPage2Handler8.OnListboxRMBUp">IPropertyManagerPage2Handler8::OnListboxRMBUp</see> to position and display a menu when the right mouse button is released. By default, only one list item can be selected at a time. When another list item is selected, that item becomes the active item, and the previously selected item is cleared. To enable multi-selection, use swPropMgrPageListBoxStyle_MultipleItemSelect with <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPageListbox.Style">IProperytManagerPageListbox:Style</see>. These methods support multi-selection:
<see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPageListbox.GetSelectedItems">IPropertyManagerPageListbox::GetSelectedItems</see> or <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPageListbox.IGetSelectedItems">IPropertyManagerPageListbox::IGetSelectedItems</see>
<see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPageListbox.GetSelectedItemsCount">IPropertyManagerPageListbox::GetSelectedItemsCount</see>
<see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPageListbox.SetSelectedItem">IPropertyManagerPageListbox::SetSelectedItem</see> See <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/Using_PropertyManagerPage2_and_the_Related_Objects.htm">Using PropertyManagerPage2 and the Related Objects</see> for more information.

Type.Name: IPropertyManagerPageNumberbox
Type.Description: Allows you to access a <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPage2">PropertyManager page</see> number box control.

Example.Name: Cut Body in Half Using Macro Feature

Type.Remarks:
Remarks
If you implement a...
Then...
Spin box
an edit box with attached up and down arrow buttons for incrementing and decrementing the value is created.
Combo box/spin box
a text box with:
a down-arrow button to display the attached drop-down list. You must set up and control the attached drop-down list
up and down buttons for incrementing and decrementing the value is created. Use <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPageNumberbox.Style">IPropertyManagerPageNumberbox::Style</see> to select the type of combo-box/spin-box number box you want to implement.
For both types of number boxes, SOLIDWORKS automatically validates the values and units. The up and down arrow buttons automatically increment and decrement the value. Both types of number boxes:
Accept numerical expressions.
Store all values as meters or radians and display them in the units specified in the current unit settings. NOTE: When a document's unit system is set to a non-metric setting, the dimension precision value (the number of digits displayed after a decimal point) is based on the number of digits specified. It is not based on the document's dimension precision settings. See <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/Using_PropertyManagerPage2_and_the_Related_Objects.htm">Using PropertyManagerPage2 and the Related Objects</see> for more information.

Type.Name: IPropertyManagerPageSelectionbox
Type.Description: Allows you to access a <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPage2">PropertyManager page</see> selection box control.

Example.Name: Show Bubble ToolTip for PropertyManager Page Control

Type.Remarks:
RemarksThe behavior of your selection boxes imitates the behavior of SOLIDWORKS selection boxes, including:
Filters that you can use to specify which types of objects can be selected for the selection box.
Toggled object selection that selects objects on the first click, and clears them on the next click.
Clear selections item on the shortcut menu in the model view. See <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/Using_PropertyManagerPage2_and_the_Related_Objects.htm">Using PropertyManagerPage2 and the Related Objects</see> for more information.

Type.Name: IPropertyManagerPageWindowFromHandle
Type.Description: Allows you to access a <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPage2">PropertyManager page</see> .NET control.

Example.Name: Add .NET Controls to SOLIDWORKS using an Add-in
Add .NET Controls to SOLIDWORKS using an Add-in

Type.Remarks: RemarksThe add-in that deploys a .NET control in a PropertyManager page must implement the event handler <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swpublished.IPropertyManagerPage2Handler8.OnWindowFromHandleControlCreated">IPropertyManagerPage2Handler8::OnWindowFromHandleControlCreated</see>. SOLIDWORKS populates the arguments of this handler when it attempts to create a .NET control on the PropertyManager page. If SOLIDWORKS is unable to create a .NET control, it passes Status = false in the handler. When Status = false, the handler must return an action to take as defined in <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swHandleWindowFromHandleCreationFailure_e">swHandleWindowFromHandleCreationFailure_e</see>. See <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/Using_PropertyManagerPage2_and_the_Related_Objects.htm">Using PropertyManagerPage2 and the Related Objects</see> for more information.

Type.Name: IPunchTable
Type.Description: Allows access to punch table information and values.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksPunch tables contain information about the punches that are created by forming tools in sheet metal parts. A punch table contains the following information about pre-selected punches:
Column Description
TAG Datum tag added to each punch in the flat pattern view
PUNCH ID Property of the forming tool or library feature
X Location Distance from the x-axis to the point of insertion of the forming tool in the flat pattern view
Y Location Distance from the y-axis to the point of insertion of the forming tool in the flat pattern view
ANGLE Angle between the x-axis and the forming tool
QUANTITY Number of times that the forming tool is used in the flat pattern view

Type.Name: IPunchTableAnnotation
Type.Description: Allows access to a punch table annotation.
Type.Remarks: RemarksThe IPunchTableAnnotation object is derived from the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ITableAnnotation">ITableAnnotation</see> object.

Type.Name: IRackPinionMateFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a rack and pinion mate feature.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksA rack and pinion mate consists of two components where:
One component (the rack) causes circular rotation in another component (the pinion) and vice versa. Neither component is required to have gear teeth. <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMateFeatureData">IMateFeatureData</see> is the parent of this mate interface. To create a rack and pinion mate:
Follow general instructions in the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate">IAssemblyDoc::CreateMate</see> Remarks. Use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> to pre-select the entities using Mark = 64 for the rack edge and Mark = 128 for the pinion face. Specify other properties of the RackPinionMateFeatureData object as required. To edit a rack and pinion mate:
Access its feature and call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetDefinition">IFeature::GetDefinition</see> to get the MateFeatureData object. Cast the MateFeatureData object to a RackPinionMateFeatureData object. Modify the RackPinionMateFeatureData object. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature::ModifyDefinition</see>. To delete this rack and pinion mate, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2">IModelDocExtension::DeleteSelection2</see>.

Type.Description: Allows access to ray-trace rendering engines.

Type.Description: Allows access to a <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IRayTraceRenderer">ray-trace rendering engine's</see> options.

Type.Name: IRefPlaneFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to reference plane feature data.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksBefore calling any of the methods and properties on this interface, you should determine the reference plane's type because some IRefPlaneFeatureData methods and properties only work with constraint-based reference planes and some only work with non-constrained reference planes. Use <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IRefPlaneFeatureData.Type2">IRefPlaneFeatureData::Type2</see> to determine the type of reference plane. If IRefPlaneFeatureData::Type2 returns swRefPlaneConstraintBase, then the reference plane is constraint based. To determine if a constraint-based reference plane has angle or offset distances references, call <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IRefPlaneFeatureData.Type">IRefPlaneFeatureData::Type</see>:
swRefPlaneAngle is returned for angle references. swRefPlaneDistance is returned for offset distance references. Otherwise, the reference plane is not constraint based. Call <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IRefPlaneFeatureData.Type">IRefPlaneFeatureData::Type</see> to determine its type. NOTE: Reference planes created in SOLIDWORKS 2010 or later are constraint based; reference planes created in SOLIDWORKS 2009 or earlier are not. Type.Name: IRefPoint
Type.Description: Allows access to reference points.

Type.Name: IRefPointFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to reference point feature data.

Type.Name: IReferenceCurve
Type.Description: Allows access to reference curves.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksThis includes the following types of curve features:
3D spline curves
Curves from file
Helix curves
Imported curves IReferenceCurve does not expose reference curve features (for example, projected curves).

Type.Name: IReferencePointCurveFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to reference-point curve feature data.

Type.Name: IRenamedDocumentReferences
Type.Description: Allows you to update references to a renamed file in unopened documents.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksThis interface corresponds to the Rename Documents dialog box in the SOLIDWORKS Design user interface. To update references to a renamed file in unopened documents:
Set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IRenamedDocumentReferences.UpdateWhereUsedReferences">IRenamedDocumentReferences::UpdateWhereUsedReferences</see> to true. Set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IRenamedDocumentReferences.IncludeFileLocations">IRenamedDocumentReferences::IncludeFileLocations</see> to true to search the folders listed under Referenced Documents in Tools > Options > System Options > File Locations. Add or remove folders in which to search using <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IRenamedDocumentReferences.AddSearchFolder">IRenamedDocumentReferences::AddSearchFolder</see> or <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IRenamedDocumentReferences.RemoveSearchFolder">IRenamedDocumentReferences::RemoveSearchFolder</see>, respectively. Get the folders to search using <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IRenamedDocumentReferences.GetSearchPath">IRenamedDocumentReferences::GetSearchPath</see>. Search for references using <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IRenamedDocumentReferences.Search">IRenamedDocumentReferences::Search</see>. Get the references found in the previous step using <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IRenamedDocumentReferences.ReferencesArray">IRenamedDocumentReferences::ReferenceArray</see>. Remove a reference from the update using <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IRenamedDocumentReferences.RemoveReference">IRenamedDocumentReferences::RemoveReference</see>. Set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IRenamedDocumentReferences.CompletionAction">IRenamedDocumentReferences::CompletionAction</see> to <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swconst.swRenamedDocumentFinalAction_e">swRenamedDocumentFinalAction_e</see>.swRenamedDocumentFinalAction_Ok.

Example.Name: Add and Delete Appearances from Specific Display States
Add and Delete Appearances from Specific Display States
Add and Delete Appearances from Specific Display States

Type.Name: IReplaceFaceFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to Replace Face feature data.

Type.Name: IRevisionCloud
Type.Description: Allows access to a revision cloud annotation.

Example.Name: Insert Revision Cloud into a Drawing
Insert Revision Cloud into a Drawing
Insert Revision Cloud into a Drawing

Type.Remarks:
RemarksTo create a revision cloud in a drawing document, call:
<see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IDrawingDoc.InsertRevisionCloud">IDrawingDoc::InsertRevisionCloud</see> or <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IDrawingDoc.IInsertRevisionCloud">IDrawingDoc::IInsertRevisionCloud</see>. <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IRevisionCloud.GetAnnotation">IRevisionCloud::GetAnnotation</see> or <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IRevisionCloud.IGetAnnotation">IRevisionCloud::IGetAnnotation</see> to get the annotation object for the revision cloud. <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IAnnotation.SetPosition">IAnnotation::SetPosition</see> to set the revision cloud position point on the drawing. If you eliminate this step, the revision cloud is rendered starting at the drawing origin of x=0, y=0, z=0. Set the revision cloud position point as follows:
For revision cloud shape... Set the revision cloud position point to...
Ellipse The center of the revision cloud.
Rectangle A corner of the revision cloud.
Polygon One of the points on the revision cloud.
Freehand One of the points on the revision cloud.
<see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IRevisionCloud.ArcRadius">IRevisionCloud::ArcRadius</see> to set the arc radius of the revision cloud.
<see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IRevisionCloud.SetPathPointAtIndex">IRevisionCloud::SetPathPointAtIndex</see> one or more times with Index = -1 to create points on the revision cloud as follows:
For revision cloud shape... Call IRevisionCloud::SetPathPointAtIndex...
Ellipse Once, specifying the coordinates of a corner of the ellipse-inscribed rectangle.
Rectangle Once, specifying the coordinates of a corner opposite the revision cloud position point.
Polygon (Number of polygon sides + 1) times, such that the first and last points coincide with the revision cloud position point.
Freehand Indefinite number of times, such that the first and last points coincide with the revision cloud position point.
<see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IRevisionCloud.Finalize">IRevisionCloud::Finalize</see> to close the revision cloud path. Once the revision cloud path is closed, you can no longer add points to it.
IRevisionCloud::SetPathPointAtIndex to modify the position of an existing point on the revision cloud.

Type.Description: Accesses the revision table annotation.
Type.Remarks: RemarksAn IRevisionTableAnnotation object is derived from an <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ITableAnnotation">ITableAnnotation</see> object.

Type.Remarks: RemarksFor more information see the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help > Sheet Metal > Using Sheet Metal Tools > Corner Reliefs and Bend Transitions > Corner Relief PropertyManager topic.

Type.Name: ISMGussetFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a sheet metal gusset feature.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksTo create a sheet metal gusset feature:
Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.CreateDefinition">IFeatureManager::CreateDefinition</see> to instantiate this feature data object. Pre-select faces, lines, edges, vertices, or points as follows:
To... Call <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> to select...
Specify the legs of the gusset feature
Two flat faces of a bend. - or -
Two flat faces adjacent to a cylindrical bend face. - or -
One cylindrical bend face. - or -
One flat face and one non-planar face adjacent to a toroidal bend. - or -
One toroidal bend face.
Optionally orient the gusset section plane
One linear edge or sketch segment that is perpendicular to the gusset section plane. If you do not pre-select either entity, then the bend line adjacent to the gusset legs is used as the reference.
Optionally position the gusset section plane
One vertex, sketch point, or reference point. If you do not pre-select any of these entities, then you must set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMGussetFeatureData.UseOffset">ISMGussetFeatureData::UseOffset</see> to true and specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMGussetFeatureData.OffsetDistance">ISMGussetFeatureData::OffsetDistance</see> to define the reference point. For insertion of the first gusset, the assumed reference point is on the end of the sheet metal bend. For second and subsequent gusset insertions, the assumed reference point is on the edge of the gusset last inserted.
Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMGussetFeatureData.ProfileDimensionScheme">ISMGussetFeatureData::ProfileDimensionScheme</see> and modify other properties on this feature data object as follows:
If ISMGussetFeatureData::ProfileDimensionScheme= <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swSheetMetalGussetProfileDimType_e">swSheetMetalGussetProfileDimType_e</see>. swSheetMetalGussetProfileDimType_ProfileDimensions, to dimension the gusset profile using... Specify ISMGussetFeatureData::...
Both legs of the gusset
<see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMGussetFeatureData.ProfileLengthDim">ProfileLengthDim</see> for d1 leg <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMGussetFeatureData.ProfileHeightDim">ProfileHeightDim</see> for d2 leg <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMGussetFeatureData.UseAngleDimForProfile">UseAngleDimForProfile</see> = false <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMGussetFeatureData.FlipDimSides">FlipDimSides</see> = true to swap d1 and d2 legs during dimensioning
d1 leg and the angle it forms with the gusset
ProfileLengthDim for d1 leg <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMGussetFeatureData.ProfileAngleDim">ProfileAngleDim</see> of angle formed by gusset intersecting d1 leg UseAngleDimForProfile = true FlipDimSides = true to swap d1 and d2 legs during dimensioning
d2 leg and the angle it forms with the gusset
ProfileHeightDim for d2 leg ProfileAngleDim of angle formed by gusset intersecting d2 leg UseAngleDimForProfile = true FlipDimSides = true to swap d1 and d2 legs during dimensioning
Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.CreateFeature">IFeatureManager::CreateFeature</see>. For more information, see the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help > Sheet Metal > Using Sheet Metal Tools > Adding Sheet Metal Gussets > Sheet Metal Gusset PropertyManager topic.

Type.Name: ISMNormalCutFeatureData2
Type.Description: Allows access to a sheet metal normal cut feature.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksExtruded cuts that pierce models at an angle have non-normal side walls. To make these side walls normal, you create a normal cut feature. To create a normal cut feature:
Open a sheet metal part that has a cut-extrude with non-normal side walls. Call IFeatureManager::CreateDefinition(swFmNormalCut) to access this interface. Set non-entity properties on this interface. Use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByRay">IModelDocExtension::SelectByRay</see> or <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> with Mark = 4 to select the offset plane, only if <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.NormalCutParameters">ISMNormalCutFeatureData2::NormalCutParameters</see> is set to <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swconst.swNormalCutParameters_e">swNormalCutParameters_e</see>.swNormalCutOffsetPlane. Use IModelDocExtension::SelectByRay or IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2 with Mark = 8 to select the direction of the normal cut, only if ISMNormalCutFeatureData2::NormalCutParameters is set to swNormalCutParameters_e.swNormalCutExtent. Use IModelDocExtension::SelectByRay or IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2 with Mark = 1 to select each non-normal face in the group. If <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.AutoPropagation">ISMNormalCutFeatureData2::AutoPropagation</see> is set to true, then all faces tangent to a selected face are automatically added to the face group. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.CreateGroup">ISMNormalCutFeatureData2::CreateGroup</see> to access <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutGroupData">ISMNormalCutGroupData</see>. Repeat steps 6 and 7 as many times as you have face groups. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDoc2.ClearSelection2">IModelDoc2::ClearSelection2</see> after each face group is created. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.CreateFeature">IFeatureManager::CreateFeature</see>. To edit a normal cut feature:
Call IFeature::GetDefinition to get this feature data object for a selected normal cut feature. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.AccessSelections">ISMNormalCutFeatureData2::AccessSelections</see>. Note: Any selections made *before* this call are invalid. To edit the properties of this feature, you must re-select their entities during the editing session, i.e., after calling ISMNormalCutFeatureData2::AccessSelections. (See step 5.) Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.GetGroupNames">ISMNormalCutFeatureData2::GetGroupNames</see> and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.GetGroupByName">ISMNormalCutFeatureData2::GetGroupByName</see> to access ISMNormalCutGroupData for an existing face group. Call ISMNormalCutFeatureData2::CreateGroup to create another face group if needed. Modify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.CutDirection">cut direction</see>, <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.OffsetPlaneReference">offset plane reference</see>, or other properties on ISMNormalCutFeatureData2 as needed. To select property entities, use IModelDocExtension::SelectByRay or IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2 followed by <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISelectionMgr.GetSelectedObject6">ISelectionMgr::GetSelectedObject6</see>. You can also use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IEntity.Select4">IEntity::Select4</see>. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature::ModifyDefinition</see> if you modifed the feature or <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.ReleaseSelectionAccess">ISMNormalCutFeatureData2::ReleaseSelectionAccess</see> if you did not.

Type.Name: ISMNormalCutGroupData
Type.Description: Allows access to a sheet metal normal cut feature's cut-extrude face group.
Type.Remarks: RemarksSee the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2">ISMNormalCutFeatureData2</see> Remarks.

Type.Remarks: RemarksSee <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/Overview/Accessing_Add-ins.htm">Accessing SOLIDWORKS Add-in Objects</see>.

Type.Description: Allows access to the SOLIDWORKS Design Checker API interface and members.
Type.Remarks: RemarksSee <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/Overview/Accessing_Add-ins.htm">Accessing SOLIDWORKS Add-in Objects</see>.

Type.Name: ISWPropertySheet
Type.Description: Allows applications to add pages to certain property sheets that are exported by the SOLIDWORKS Design application.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksSee <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swPropSheetType_e">swPropSheetType_e</see> for a list of the property sheets that support this functionality. An example of a property sheet is the dialog that is displayed when you click Tools > Options. This dialog consists of a base property sheet and property pages stacked on top of it. To display a specific property page, click its tab. The MFC class that implements a property sheet is CPropertysheet, and the MFC class that implements a property page is CPropertyPage. ISWPropertySheet is a OLE wrapper class over the SOLIDWORKS CPropertysheet class. This means that SOLIDWORKS API programmers can add their own CPropertyPages to a SOLIDWORKS Design property sheet. A SOLIDWORKS Design property sheet is different from an <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPage2">IPropertyManager</see> page. A PropertyManager page is displayed when the PropertyManager tab is selected on the left-side panel. PropertyManager pages have replaced numerous dialogs. Creating PropertyPages When a property sheet is created that can have pages added to it, the notification swAppPropertySheetCreateNotify is sent via the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks">ISldWorks</see> interface. This notification is sent as swAppPropertySheetCreateNotify( LPDISPATCH sheet, long type) where sheet is the IDispatch interface of a ISWPropertySheet object and type is an enumerated constant of type swPropSheetType_e. When the application receives this notification, it can check the type of the sheet from the type argument. If pages are to be added, then the sequence of operations is:
Ensure that the application resources will be used to make the page (for example by calling AfxSetResourceHandle())
Create the CPropertyPage-derived class
For 32-bit applications, pass the CPropertyPage object to <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISWPropertySheet.AddPage">ISWPropertySheet::AddPage</see>, casting the CPropertyPage* to a long
For 64-bit applications, pass the CPropertyPage object to <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISWPropertySheet.AddPagex64">ISWPropertySheet::AddPagex64</see>, casting the CPropertyPage* to a long long
Reset the resources to their previous state Destroying PropertyPages The CPropertyPage PostNcDestroy function is called by the SOLIDWORKS Design application when the property sheet is being destroyed. At this point, the application should delete any objects (for example the CPropertyPage object.) Events are implemented with delegates in the Microsoft .NET Framework. See the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks_namespace">Overview</see> topic for a list of delegates for this interface.

Type.Name: ISafeArrayUtility
Type.Description:
Access the ISafeArrayUtility interface, which can:
get an unpacked array of native SOLIDWORKS Dispatch-based objects of the same data type and return a packed Variant SafeArray to use in methods that requires passing a packed Variant SafeArray. get a packed Variant SafeArray and return an unpacked array of native SOLIDWORKS Dispatch-based objects of the same data type. get a Variant SafeArray and return the number of SafeArray objects in the Variant SafeArray and their data type. get and put a value in a Variant SafeArray of the same data type.

Example.Name: Get Scale Factor of Each Model View

Type.Remarks:
RemarksThe ISafeArrayUtility interface replaces the SOLIDWORKS SafeArray template class, which you might have used in earlier versions of SOLIDWORKS to instantiate SafeArrays for methods requiring Variant arrays in your C++ projects. This ISafeArrayUtility interface's methods are only compatible with raw pointers and BSTRs; this interface's methods are not compatible with smart pointers (i.e., reference counted) or the Active Template Library (ATL) class CComBSTR. For example:
IDispatch* pDisp1; //This works IDispatchPtr pDisp2 //This does not work CComPtr pDisp3 //This does not work BSTR fileName1 //This works CComBSTR fileName2 //This does not work

RemarksTo obtain the data for the entire mesh:
Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swscanto3d.IScanto3D.GetMeshCount">IScanto3D::GetMeshCount</see> to get the number of mesh features, n. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swscanto3d.IScanto3D.GetMeshDataCountAtIndex">IScanto3D::GetMeshDataCountAtIndex</see> iteratively n times to get the number of points and facets in each mesh feature. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swscanto3d.IScanto3D.GetMeshDataAtIndex">IScanto3D::GetMeshDataAtIndex</see> iteratively n times to get the data in each mesh feature.

Type.Name: IScrewMateFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a screw mate feature.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksA screw mate consists of two components, where:
Components are concentric. Translation of one component along the axis causes rotation of the other component according to a pitch relationship. Rotation of one component causes translation of the other component. <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMateFeatureData">IMateFeatureData</see> is the parent of this mate interface. To create a screw mate:
Follow general instructions in the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate">IAssemblyDoc::CreateMate</see> Remarks. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IScrewMateFeatureData.EntitiesToMate">IScrewMateFeatureData::EntitiesToMate</see> or use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> to pre-select the entities using Mark = 1. Specify other properties of the ScrewMateFeatureData object. as required. To edit a screw mate:
Access its feature and call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetDefinition">IFeature::GetDefinition</see> to get the MateFeatureData object. Cast the MateFeatureData object to a ScrewMateFeatureData object. Modify the ScrewMateFeatureData object. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature::ModifyDefinition</see>. To delete this screw mate, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2">IModelDocExtension::DeleteSelection2</see>.

Type.Name: ISimpleCornerTreatmentFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a simple corner treatment feature of a structure system.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksThis interface is:
derived from <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ICornerTreatmentFeatureData">ICornerTreatmentFeatureData</see>. valid only if <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ICornerTreatmentFeatureData.IgnoreCornerTreatment">ICornerTreatmentFeatureData::IgnoreCornerTreatment</see> is false. A simple corner is the position in a structure system where the ends of two members meet either in a body trim or a planar trim fashion. In the SOLIDWORKS Design user interface, the Simple Corner PropertyManager contains two lists that you can manage using the APIs in this interface and elsewhere:
<see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ICornerTreatmentGroupFolder.GetCornerTreatments">Corner groups</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleCornerTreatmentFeatureData.UserDefinedTrimFaces">User defined trim</see> faces For more information, see:
SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help > Weldments and Structure System > Structure System > Corner Management > Editing Simple Corners SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help > Weldments and Structure System > Structure System > Simple Corner PropertyManager

Type.Name: ISimpleFilletFeatureData2
Type.Description: Allows access to a simple fillet feature.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksTo create a simple fillet feature:
Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.CreateDefinition">IFeatureManager::CreateDefinition</see>, passing Type = <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swFeatureNameID_e">swFeatureNameID_e</see>.swFmFillet, to create an instance of ISimpleFilletFeatureData2. Initialize the fillet/chamfer to a simple fillet type as follows:
For... Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.Initialize">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::Initialize</see>,passing FilletType = <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swconst.swSimpleFilletType_e">swSimpleFilletType_e</see>...
Constant radius fillet Offset face chamfer swConstRadiusFillet
Face fillet Face-face chamfer swFaceFillet
Full round fillet swFullRoundFillet Complete the fillet/chamfer type specification by specifying a feature fillet profile type:
For... Set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile</see> to <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swFeatureFilletProfileType_e">swFeatureFilletProfileType_e</see>....
Constant radius fillet
swFeatureFilletCircular (symmetric or asymmetric) swFeatureFilletConicRho (symmetric or asymmetric) swFeatureFilletConicRadius (symmetric)
Offset face chamfer swFeatureFilletConicRhoZeroChamfer
Face fillet
swFeatureFilletCircular (symmetric, asymmetric, chord width, or hold line) swFeatureFilletConicRho (symmetric, asymmetric, or chord width) swFeatureFilletConicRadius (symmetric or chord width)
Face-face chamfer swFeatureFilletConicRhoZeroChamfer
Full round fillet swFeatureFilletCircular Specify other ISimpleFilletFeatureData2 properties as follows:.
To create... You must...
Constant radius fillet/offset face chamfer
Call <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> with Mark = 1 to select the edges, faces, features, or loops to fillet. Set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.OverflowType">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::OverflowType</see>. (Optional) For both fillets and chamfers, set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.KeepFeatures">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::KeepFeatures</see> and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.PropagateToTangentFaces">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::PropagateToTangentFaces</see>. (Optional) For fillets only, set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.RoundCorners">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::RoundCorners</see>, <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.ConstantWidth">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConstantWidth</see>, and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.CurvatureContinuous">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::CurvatureContinuous</see> (if set to true, then ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::RoundCorners and ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile are not valid). If a symmetric fillet/chamfer:- For fillets or chamfers, set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.DefaultDistance">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultRadius</see> to a default fillet radius or chamfer offset distance.- For fillets, if ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::CurvatureContinuous is false and ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile is set to swFeatureFilletCircular, then you can set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.IsMultipleRadius">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::IsMultipleRadius</see>. If MultipleRadius is set to true, then you can call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.SetRadius">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::SetRadius</see> to specify multiple edge radii. If ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::CurvatureContinuous is false and ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile is set to swFeatureFilletConicRho or swFeatureFilletConicRadius, set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.DefaultConicRhoOrRadius">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultConicRhoOrRadius</see> to a conic rho value between 0.05 and 0.95, inclusive, or a conic radius value, respectively. - For chamfers, if ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::IsMultipleRadius is set to true, then you can call ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::SetRadius to set multiple offset distances. If an asymmetric fillet/chamfer: - Set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.AsymmetricFillet">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::AsymmetricFillet</see>. - Set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultRadius to the fillet Distance 1 radius or chamfer Offset Distance 1. - Set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.DefaultDistance">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultDistance</see> to the fillet Distance 2 radius or chamfer Offset Distance 2. - For fillets only, if ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::CurvatureContinuous is false and ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile is set to swFeatureFilletConicRho, set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultConicRhoOrRadius to a conic rho value between 0.05 and 0.95, inclusive. For more information, see the Constant Size Fillets and Chamfer PropertyManager topics in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help.
Face fillet/face-face chamfer
Call IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2 with: - Mark = 2 to select Face Set 1. - Mark = 4 to select Face Set 2.
(Optional) For both fillets and chamfers, set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::PropagateToTangentFaces and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.HelpPoint">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::HelpPoint</see>. (Optional) For fillets only, set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::CurvatureContinuous (if set to true, then ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile is not valid). If a symmetric fillet/chamfer: - Set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultRadius for the fillet radius or the chamfer offset distance. - For fillets only, if ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::CurvatureContinuous is false and ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile is set to swFeatureFilletConicRho or swFeatureFilletConicRadius, set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultConicRhoOrRadius to a conic rho or conic radius value. If a chord width fillet/chamfer: - Set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultRadius to set the chord width. - For fillets only, if ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::CurvatureContinuous is false and ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile is set to swFeatureFilletConicRho or swFeatureFilletConicRadius, set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultConicRhoOrRadius to a conic rho or conic radius value. If an asymmetric fillet/chamfer: - Set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::AsymmetricFillet. - Set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultRadius to the fillet Distance 1 radius or the chamfer Offset Distance 1. - Set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultDistance to the fillet Distance 2 radius or the chamfer Offset Distance 2. - For fillets only, if ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::CurvatureContinuous is false and ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile is set to swFeatureFilletConicRho, set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultConicRhoOrRadius to a conic rho value. If a hold line fillet/chamfer: - Call IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2 with Mark = 8 to select the hold line edges. - Set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.HoldLines">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::HoldLines</see> to the hold line edges. For more information, see the Face Fillets and Chamfer PropertyManager topics in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help.
Full round fillet
Call IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2 with: - Mark = 2 to select Face Set 1. - Mark = 512 to select Center Face Set. - Mark = 4 to select Face Set 2. (Optional) Set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::PropagateToTangentFaces. For more information, see the Full Round Fillets topic in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help.
Setback fillet
Follow the instructions above to create a constant radius fillet. Use the setback methods on ISimpleFilletFeatureData2 to set the setback distances from setback vertices of fillet corners. For more information, see the Constant Size Fillets topic in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help.
Partial edge fillet/chamfer
Follow the instructions above to create a constant radius fillet or offset face chamfer. Set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.EnablePartialEdgeParameters">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::EnablePartialEdgeParameters</see> to true. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.GetPartialEdgeFilletData">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::GetPartialEdgeFilletData</see>. Set other properties of IPartialEdgeFilletData as required. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.SetPartialEdgeFilletData">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::SetPartialEdgeFilletData</see>, passing in the IPartialEdgeFilletData populated in step d. Repeat steps c-e for each edge to partially fillet. For more information, see the Constant Size Fillets and Chamfer PropertyManager topics in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help.
Create the fillet/chamfer feature by calling <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.CreateFeature">IFeatureManager::CreateFeature</see>. For more information about fillets, see the Fillets topic in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help. See <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/Miscellaneous/Accessing_Selections_that_Define_Features.htm">Accessing Selections that Define Features</see> for additional details.

Type.Description: Represents an area hatch, which is inserted into a SOLIDWORKS drawing polygon or component face when you click Insert > Annotations > Area Hatch/Fill in a SOLIDWORKS drawing.

Type.Name: ISketchManager

Create Block Definition and Insert Block Instance
Create Block Definition and Insert Block Instance
Create Block Definition and Insert Block Instance

Type.Name: ISketchParabola
Type.Description: Provides access to sketched parabolas.

Type.Name: ISketchPath
Type.Description: Provides access to the methods and properties for paths in sketches.

Type.Name: ISketchPatternFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a sketch-driven pattern feature in a part.

Example.Name: Get Properties of Sketch Pattern Feature
Get Properties of Sketch Pattern Feature
Get Properties of Sketch Pattern Feature

Type.Remarks:
RemarksRead <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/Pattern_Features_and_their_Feature_Data_Objects.htm">Pattern Features and their Feature Data Objects</see>. Before calling IFeatureManager::CreateDefinition, you must use <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> to pre-select the entities needed to create the circular pattern feature. To select the required entities, use these selection Marks:
features = 4
points = 32
sketches = 64
faces = 128
bodies = 256 You must call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.CreateFeature">IFeatureManager::CreateFeature</see> after initializing this feature data object in order to successfully create a sketch-driven pattern. For more information, see the Sketch Driven Patterns topic in the SOLIDWORKS Help.

Type.Name: ISketchPicture
Type.Description: Provides access to pictures on sketches (i.e., .bmp, .gif, .jpg, .jpeg, .tif, and .wmf).

Type.Name: ISketchPoint
Type.Description: Provides access to sketch point entities.

Example.Name: Get Sketch Points and Sketch Point IDs
Get x,y,z Locations of Points in Sketch

Type.Remarks: RemarksThe ISketchPoint object provides access to sketch points while the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchSegment">ISketchSegment</see> object provides access to sketch arcs, lines, ellipses, parabolas, and splines and their corresponding <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchArc">ISketchArc</see>, <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchEllipse">ISketchEllipse</see>, <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchLine">ISketchLine</see>, <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchParabola">ISketchParabola</see>, <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchText">ISketchText</see>, and <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchSpline">ISketchSpline</see> interfaces.

Type.Name: ISketchRegion
Type.Description: Provides access to sketch regions.

Example.Name: Determine If Sketch Contour or Sketch Region

Type.Remarks: RemarksSketch regions are white space on a sketch bordered by sketch entities or portions of sketch entities basically forming a face. A centerline within a sketch creates sketch regions inside that sketch.

Type.Name: ISketchRelation
Type.Description: Provides access to the entities for a sketch relation.

Type.Name: ISketchRelationManager
Type.Description: Provides access to all sketch relations.
Type.Remarks: RemarksYou can get the associated entities for each sketch relation and vice versa.

Type.Name: ISketchSegment
Type.Description: Provides access to functions that are common among sketch entities.

Example.Name: Select Chain of Entities Attached to a Sketch Segment
Select Chain of Entities Attached to a Sketch Segment
Select Chain of Entities Attached to a Sketch Segment

Type.Remarks: RemarksA SketchSegment can represent a sketch arc, line, ellipse, parabola or spline. ISketchSegment provides functions that are generic to every type of sketch segment. For example, every sketch segment has an ID and can be programmatically selected. Therefore, the ISketchSegment interface provides functions to obtain the ID and to select the item. (For access to sketched points, see the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchPoint">ISketchPoint</see> object)

Type.Name: ISketchSlot
Type.Description: Accesses a sketch slot.

Get All Sheet Metal Feature Data

Type.Remarks: RemarksFor details about sheet metal sketched bends, see the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help > Sheet Metal > Using Sheet Metal Tools > Sketched Bends topic.

Type.Name: ISldWorks
Type.Description: Provides direct and indirect access to all other interfaces exposed in the SOLIDWORKS API.

Example.Name: Get Names of Creators of Features

Type.Remarks: RemarksThis interface is the highest-level object in the SOLIDWORKS API. This interface provides a general set of functions that allow application-level operations such as create, open, close, and quit documents, arrange icons and windows, change the active document, and create attribute definitions. Use CreateObject, GetObject, New, or similar functions to obtain the ISldWorks object from a Dispatch application (Visual Basic or C++ Dispatch). Standalone .exe C++ COM applications can use CoCreateInstance. All of the SOLIDWORKS API add-in wizards automatically create the ISldWorks object for you. Events are implemented with delegates in the Microsoft .NET Framework. See the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks_namespace">Overview</see> topic for a list of delegates for this interface.

Type.Name: ISlicingData
Type.Description: Allows access to slicing tool data.
Type.Remarks: RemarksYou must pre-select the first slicing plane before you can access the default bounding box directions for slicing. <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.InsertSlicing">IFeatureManager::InsertSlicing</see> takes this data object and invokes the Slicing tool. The Slicing tool creates a parallel or radial series of slicing planes with sketches that intersect, or slice, the model. For more information, see the Slicing Tool topics in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help.

Type.Name: ISlotMateFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a slot mate feature.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksA slot mate is a mate between:
A bolt and either a straight slot or an arced slot. Two slots, straight or arced <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMateFeatureData">IMateFeatureData</see> is the parent of this mate interface. To create a slot mate:
Follow general instructions in the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate">IAssemblyDoc::CreateMate</see> Remarks. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISlotMateFeatureData.EntitiesToMate">ISlotMateFeatureData::EntitiesToMate</see> or use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> to pre-select the entities using Mark = 1. Specify other properties of the SlotMateFeatureData object. as required. To edit a slot mate:
Access its feature and call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetDefinition">IFeature::GetDefinition</see> to get the MateFeatureData object. Cast the MateFeatureData object to a SlotMateFeatureData object. Modify the SlotMateFeatureData object. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature::ModifyDefinition</see>. To delete this slot mate, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2">IModelDocExtension::DeleteSelection2</see>.

Type.Name: ISmartComponentFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a Smart Component.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksA Smart Component is defined by:
Components Features Feature references A Smart Component is created in a training assembly. When the Smart Component is saved, it is saved with the training assembly in a SOLIDWORKS part. When the Smart Component is inserted or edited in a target assembly, the training assembly opens in a small preview window, and the PropertyManager page of the Smart Component displays. See the SOLIDWORKS Help for more information about Smart Components.
Use... To...
This interface
Gain access to the training assembly of a Smart Component. Gain access to the selection lists on the PropertyManager page of a Smart Component. Insert features and components into a Smart Component. Delete features and components from a Smart Component.
<see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IComponent2.GetSmartComponentData">IComponent2::GetSmartComponentData</see> Get the current features, components, and feature references of a Smart Component.
<see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IComponent2.SetSmartComponentData">IComponent2::SetSmartComponentData</see> Change which features and components to enable in a Smart Component and to insert Smart Features in a target assembly.

Type.Name: ISnapShot
Type.Description: Allows access to the snapshot of the graphics area of an assembly opened in Large Design Review mode.

Example.Name: Open Assembly in Large Design Review Mode
Open Assembly in Large Design Review Mode
Open Assembly in Large Design Review Mode

Type.Remarks:
RemarksTo open an assembly in Large Design Review mode:
Call <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.GetOpenDocSpec">ISldWorks::GetOpenDocSpec</see> to create an instance of <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IDocumentSpecification">IDocumentSpecification</see>. Set <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IDocumentSpecification.ViewOnly">IDocumentSpecification::ViewOnly</see> to true. Call <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.OpenDoc7">ISldWorks::OpenDoc7</see>, passing it the instance of IDocumentSpecification. - or -Call <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.OpenDoc6">ISldWorks::OpenDoc6</see> with the Options parameter set to swOpenDocOptions_e.swOpenDocOptions_ViewOnly.

Type.Name: ISplineHandle
Type.Description: Provides access to spline handles.
Type.Remarks: RemarksTo enable spline tangency and curvature handles, set <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.SetUserPreferenceToggle">ISldWorks::SetUserPreferenceToggle</see> swDisplayAllSplineHandles to True. NOTE: <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISelectionMgr.GetSelectedObjectType3">ISelectionMgr::GetSelectedObjectType3</see> returns swSelMANIPULATORS for a spline handle.

Type.Name: ISplineParamData
Type.Description: Allows access to the parameterization data of a spline.

Type.Name: ISplitBodyFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a Split feature.
Type.Remarks:
Remarks<see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetTypeName2">IFeature::GetTypeName2</see> and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetTypeName">IFeature::GetTypeName</see> return:
Split for a feature that was created by splitting a part into multiple parts by using either <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.PostSplitBody">IFeatureManager::PostSplitBody</see> or the Split feature in the user interface. You can access a split-body feature's data using the ISplitBodyFeatureData interface.
SplitBody for a body created by splitting a part and saving the body to a part. You cannot access the data of a split body saved to a part.
