Type.Remarks:
RemarksTo create a stack of balloons:
Select an item to create the first balloon in the stack.
Call <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.CreateStackedBalloonOptions">IModelDocExtension::CreateStackedBalloonOptions</see> to create an IStackedBalloonOptions object. Set the properties on the IStackedBalloonOptions object. Pass the IStackedBalloonOptions object in a call to <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.InsertStackedBalloon2">IModelDocExtension::InsertStackedBalloon2</see>.
Select one or more items to add to the stack.

Type.Name: IStatusBarPane
Type.Description: Controls user-created status bar panes in the lower-right corner of the SOLIDWORKS status bar.
Type.Remarks: RemarksTo use a status bar pane in a project, declare it in your project and manage it during the life cycle of the client application and release just before the client application disconnects from SOLIDWORKS. You can create up to five (5) panes.

Type.Name: IStraightElementData
Type.Description: Allows access to the data of a simple hole element in an Advanced Hole.
Type.Remarks: RemarksTo create an Advanced Hole feature, see the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.AdvancedHole">IFeatureManager::AdvancedHole</see> Remarks.

Type.Name: IStraightTapElementData
Type.Description: Allows access to the data of a straight tap hole element in an Advanced Hole.
Type.Remarks: RemarksTo create an Advanced Hole feature, see the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.AdvancedHole">IFeatureManager::AdvancedHole</see> Remarks.

Type.Name: IStructuralMemberFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a structural member.

Type.Name: IStructuralMemberGroup
Type.Description: Allows access to a weldment structural-member group.

Type.Name: IStructureSystemFolder
Type.Description: Allows access to a structure system folder.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksThis interface accesses the top-level folder of a structure system in the FeatureManager design tree. The structure system folder contains one or more profile group folders. Each profile group folder contains profile references and structure system members. When a structure system is created in the user interface, the Corner Management PropertyManager opens automatically. When structure systems are created using the API, a Corner ManagementX folder is automatically created for each structure system in the FeatureManager design tree. A structure system and its corner management folder appears similar to the following in the FeatureManager design tree. In parentheses are the APIs that you use to access the corresponding item: - Structure System1 (IStructureSystemFolder accessors) - Structure System Grid1 - (1) (<see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IProfileGroupFolder">IProfileGroupFolder</see> accessors) - Plane2 (profile reference plane - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IProfileGroupFolder.GetPlane">IProfileGroupFolder::GetPlane</see>) - Sketch11 (profile sketch - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IProfileGroupFolder.GetSketch">IProfileGroupFolder::GetSketch</see>) - Member1 (structure system member - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IProfileGroupFolder.GetStructureSystemMembers">IProfileGroupFolder::GetStructureSystemMembers</see>) - Corner Management1 (<see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ICornerManagementFolder">ICornerManagementFolder</see> accessors) - Complex Corner Group1 (<see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ICornerTreatmentGroupFolder">ICornerTreatmentGroupFolder</see> accessors) - Corner5 (<see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ICornerTreatmentFeatureData">ICornerTreatmentFeatureData</see> accessors and then cast to <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IComplexCornerTreatmentFeatureData">IComplexCornerTreatmentFeatureData</see>) - more corners... (Each corner in a complex corner group contains multiple corner members. If you edit a corner to open a Corner Management PropertyManager in the user interface, on the Complex tab are three boxes that list corner members for Trim Tool, Body Trim, and Planar Trim. Use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ICornerMember">ICornerMember</see> to access these corner members.) - Two member Corner Group1 (ICornerTreatmentGroupFolder accessors) - Corner1 (ICornerTreatmentFeatureData accessors and then cast to <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ITwoMemberCornerTreatmentFeatureData">ITwoMemberCornerTreatmentFeatureData</see>) - more corners... (Each corner in a two member corner group contains two corner members, one for Trim Tool, and one for Body Trim. Use ICornerMember to access these corner members.) - Simple Corner Group1 (ICornerTreatmentGroupFolder accessors) - Corner9 (ICornerTreatmentFeatureData accessors and then cast to <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleCornerTreatmentFeatureData">ISimpleCornerTreatmentFeatureData</see>) - more corners...
To create a structure system:
Create an <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData">IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData</see> object for every primary and secondary structure system member you intend to create. Create <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemSplitMember">IStructureSystemSplitMember</see> objects as needed. Use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.IsSplit">IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData::IsSplit</see> to indicate that split members exist. Create one or more <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemMemberProfile">IStructureSystemMemberProfile</see> objects as the number of different profiles is needed. Cast the IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData objects to <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPrimaryStructuralMemberFeatureData">IPrimaryStructuralMemberFeatureData</see> objects and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISecondaryStructuralMemberFeatureData">ISecondaryStructuralMemberFeatureData</see> objects as needed. Create specific primary member feature data objects by casting IPrimaryStructuralMemberFeatureData objects to: - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPrimaryMemberFacePlaneIntersectionFeatureData">IPrimaryMemberFacePlaneIntersectionFeatureData</see> - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPrimaryMemberPathSegmentFeatureData">IPrimaryMemberPathSegmentFeatureData</see> - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPrimaryMemberPointLengthFeatureData">IPrimaryMemberPointLengthFeatureData</see> - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPrimaryMemberRefPlaneFeatureData">IPrimaryMemberRefPlaneFeatureData</see> Create specific secondary member feature data objects by casting ISecondaryStructuralMemberFeatureData objects to: - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISecondaryMemberBetweenPointsFeatureData">ISecondaryMemberBetweenPointsFeatureData</see> - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISecondaryMemberSupportPlaneFeatureData">ISecondaryMemberSupportPlaneFeatureData</see> Use the methods and properties on the specific primary and secondary member feature data objects to detail the structure system members. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.CreateStructureSystem">IModelDocExtension::CreateStructureSystem</see>(primaryFDArray, secondaryFDArray), where primaryFDArray is an array of primary IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData objects and secondaryFDArray is an array of secondary IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData objects created in step 1. To edit a structure system:
Get the structure system folder feature, which is returned by IModelDocExtension::CreateStructureSystem in step 8 above. Then call the accessor of this interface, IFeature::GetSpecificFeature2.(Or call both accessors of this interface.) Use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemFolder.GetProfileGroupFolders">IStructureSystemFolder::GetProfileGroupFolders</see> to access the profile group folders in a structure system folder. Use IProfileGroupFolder methods and properties to get the sketch, reference plane, and structure system members in each profile group folder. Use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.StructureSystemMemberType">IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData::StructureSystemMemberType</see> to determine whether a structure system member retrieved in step 3 is a primary or a secondary member. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.AccessSelections">IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData::AccessSelections</see> before editing the selections used to create the structure system. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.ReleaseSelectionAccess">IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData::ReleaseSelectionAccess</see> after editing. Cast IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData objects to their subclass feature data objects (see create steps 5 and 6). If you need to change a structure member's profile, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.MemberProfile">IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData::MemberProfile</see> to get the IStructureSystemMemberProfile object for each structure member. Complete the structure system edit by calling <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.GetFeature">IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData::GetFeature</see>, calling methods and properties on objects retrieved in previous steps as required, and finally calling <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature::ModifyDefinition</see>. Use the examples as models to create and edit structure sytems in your own applications. For more information, read the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help > Weldments and Structure System > Structure System topics.

Type.Name: IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a structure system member.
Type.Remarks: RemarksThis interface is the superclass of <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPrimaryStructuralMemberFeatureData">IPrimaryStructuralMemberFeatureData</see> and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISecondaryStructuralMemberFeatureData">ISecondaryStructuralMemberFeatureData</see>. See the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemFolder">IStructureSystemFolder</see> Remarks. For more information about structure system members, see the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help > Weldments and Structure System > Structure System > Primary Member PropertyManager and Secondary Member PropertyManager topics.

Type.Name: IStructureSystemMemberProfile
Type.Description: Allows access to a structure system member profile.
Type.Remarks: RemarksSee the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemFolder">IStructureSystemFolder</see> Remarks. For more information, read the SOLDWORKS user-interface help > Weldments and Structure System > Structure System > Profile PropertyManager topic.

Type.Name: IStructureSystemSplitMember
Type.Description: Allows access to a structure system split member.
Type.Remarks: RemarksSee the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemFolder">IStructureSystemFolder</see> Remarks. For more information, see the Split Member sections of the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help > Weldments and Structure System > Structure System > Primary Member PropertyManager and Secondary Member PropertyManager topics.

Type.Description: Allows access to an extruded surface feature.

Example.Name: Get Data for Surface Revolve Feature

Type.Remarks: RemarksThis interface allows you to get the surface type and various surface definition data as well as evaluate and reverse evaluate locations on the surface.

Type.Description: Allows access to a surface-cut feature.
Type.Remarks: RemarksTo access this interface, you must declare it as SurfCutFeatureData or ISurfCutFeatureData. See the examples for details.

Type.Description: Allows access to a surface-extend feature.

Type.Name: ISurfaceFlattenFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a surface-flatten feature.

Type.Name: ISurfaceParameterizationData
Type.Description: Allows access to the parameterization data of a surface.
Type.Remarks: RemarksIf a surface is periodic in one direction (cylinder, cone, torus, sphere), then U is the periodic direction. The -10000 to 10000 parameter range is the modeling limit for the modeler. This means that the values are effectively infinite in size. To get the parameter range from a given face, use <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IFace2.GetBox">IFace2::GetBox</see> or <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IFace2.IGetBox">IFace2::IGetBox</see>, <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISurface.GetClosestPointOn">ISurface::GetClosestPointOn</see> or <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISurface.IGetClosestPointOn">ISurface::IGetClosestPointOn</see>, and <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISurface.ReverseEvaluate">ISurface::ReverseEvaluate</see> or <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISurface.IReverseEvaluate">ISurface::IReverseEvaluate</see>. These methods provide a true parameter range that the face is using on the surface.

Type.Name: ISurfacePlanarFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a planar surface feature.

Type.Name: ISurfaceRadiateFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a surface radiate feature.

Type.Name: ISurfaceTrimFeatureData

Type.Name: ISw3DPrinter
Type.Description: Allows access to rapid prototype devices.

Type.Name: ISw3DPrinter
Type.Description: Allows access to rapid prototype devices.

Type.Name: ISwAddin
Type.Description: Allows applications to create SOLIDWORKS add-ins.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksTo use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros.htm">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see>. If you are creating a COM-style addin and are using an MFC CCmdTarget-derived object to implement ISwAddin, you must fully implement ITypeInfo as follows:
In the declaration of your CCmdTarget-derived class, add:
DECLARE_OLETYPELIB()
__declspec( dllexport ) virtual BOOL GetDispatchIID(IID* pIID);

Type.Name: ISwAddinAdvancedOptionBroker
Type.Description: Allows add-ins to remove dismissed messages from Tools > Options > System Options > Messages/Errors/Warnings.
Type.Remarks: RemarksTo use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros.htm">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see>. See the System Options - Messages/Errors/Warnings topic in SOLIDWORKS help for more information about dismissed messages.

Type.Name: ISwAddinBroker
Type.Description: Gets information about an add-in's entities so that SOLIDWORKS can interact with those entities.
Type.Remarks: RemarksTo use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros.htm">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see>.

Type.Name: ISwCalloutHandler
Type.Description: Must be implemented by an add-in application to create <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ICallout">callouts</see>.
Type.Remarks: RemarksTo use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros.htm">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see>.

Type.Name: ISwColorContour1
Type.Description: Allows access to the color and display values of curvature in a SOLIDWORKS model.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksWhen implemented, the methods of this interface allow you to assign colors and display values of curvature in a SOLIDWORKS model. To use ISwColorContour1:
Implement the ISwColorContour1 interface in an add-in class.
Install the implemented interface in the SOLIDWORKS software using <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.InstallModelColorizer">IModelDocExtension::InstallModelColorizer</see>.
Run the add-in and open a model document in SOLIDWORKS.
In SOLIDWORKS select View > Display > Curvature. The model is colorized by the implemented interface.
When you finalize the application, remove the implemented interface from the SOLIDWORKS software using <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.RemoveModelColorizer">IModelDocExtension::RemoveModelColorizer</see>. NOTE: Only one color and display interface can be active at any one time. The last color and display interface installed is the active one. If you remove that color and display interface, then the color and display interface installed before it becomes the active color and display interface. This interface overrides the color and display functionality of the SOLIDWORKS Curvature tool. See SOLIDWORKS Help for details about the SOLIDWORKS Curvature tool. To use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros.htm">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see>.

Type.Name: ISwComFeature
Type.Description: Allows applications to create macro features using COM.
Type.Remarks: RemarksSee <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/Macro_Features/Exposed_COM_DLL_or_Executable.htm">Exposed COM DLL or Executable and Macro Features</see> and <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/Macro_Features/Overview_of_Macro_Features.htm">Overview of Macro Features</see> for more information. To use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros.htm">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see>.

Type.Name: ISwHtmlInterface
Type.Description: Must be implemented in each add-in's Quick Tips HTML page so that users can interact with the add-in's Quick Tips and see associated Bubble ToolTips.
Type.Remarks: RemarksTo access this API, include the following line of code in your application. See <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/Overview/Quick_Tips_and_Bubble_ToolTips.htm">Quick Tips and Bubble ToolTips</see> for more information. CreateObject('SwHtmlControl.SwHtmlInterface')

Type.Name: ISwManipulatorHandler2
Type.Description: Must be implemented by an add-in application to interact with a <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IManipulator">manipulator</see>.

Example.Name: Insert and Use Plane with Manipulator
Insert and Use Plane with Manipulator
Insert and Use Plane with Manipulator

Type.Remarks:
RemarksTo use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros.htm">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see>. The add-in application performs such actions as:
Defining how a manipulator moves. For example, the add-in application has the manipulator follow a surface in order to place an image on that surface.
Providing any temporary graphics associated with manipulator. For example, to display a temporary body in a part, the add-in application must call <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IBody2.Display3">IBody2::Display3</see>.
Applying transforms using <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IBody2.ApplyTransform">IBody2::ApplyTransform</see>. To create a manipulator, first create the SwManipulatorHandler2 object and then create the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IManipulator">IManipulator</see> object. See <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/Manipulators.htm">Manipulators</see> for details.

Type.Name: ISwOLEObject
Type.Description: Allows access to an OLE object.

Type.Name: ISwPEClassFactory
Type.Description: Allows access to the callback object used by <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swpublished.ISwPEManager">ISwPEManager</see> to send a license key back to SOLIDWORKS for SOLIDWORKS Partner entitlement verification.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksThis interface provides a callback mechanism in which:
SOLIDWORKS requests the partner's key through the add-in by calling <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swpublished.ISwPEManager.IdentifyToSW">ISwPEManager::IdentifyToSW</see>, The partner add-in sends a license key back to SOLIDWORKS in <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISwPEClassFactory.SetPartnerKey">ISwPEClassFactory::SetPartnerKey</see>, and SOLIDWORKS uses the license key to verify the entitlement of the SOLIDWORKS Partner and returns <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISwPEToken">ISwPEToken</see>. See <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/GettingStarted/SolidWorks_Partner_Program_2.htm">SOLIDWORKS Partner Program</see>.

Type.Name: ISwPEManager
Type.Description: Allows SOLIDWORKS Partners to create SOLIDWORKS add-ins that have been registered with the SOLIDWORKS Partner Program team.
Type.Remarks: RemarksThis interface and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swpublished.ISwAddin">ISwAddin</see> are implemented in add-ins of SOLIDWORKS Partners who participate in the <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/GettingStarted/SolidWorks_Partner_Program_2.htm">SOLIDWORKS Partner Program</see>.

Type.Name: ISwPEToken
Type.Description: *For future use*

To use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros.htm">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see>.

Type.Remarks: RemarksCall <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelView.GraphicsRedraw">IModelView::GraphicsRedraw</see> to repaint the graphics area after changing any scene.

Type.Remarks: RemarksTo use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros.htm">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see>.

Type.Description: Allows access to a sweep feature.

Insert Swept-cut Feature with Bidirectional Twist

Type.Remarks: RemarksTo create a sweep feature, see <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/Sweep_Features_and_SweepFeatureData_Objects.htm">Sweep Features and SweepFeatureData Objects</see>.

Type.Name: ISweptFlangeFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a sheet metal swept flange feature.
Type.Remarks: RemarksFor more information about swept flanges, read the SOLIDWORKS Help > Sheet Metal > Using Sheet Metal Tools > Swept Flange > Swept Flange PropertyManager topic.

Type.Name: ISymmetricMateFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to symmetry mate feature data.
Type.Remarks:
Remarks Symmetry mates force two similar entities to be symmetric about a plane or planar face. <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMateFeatureData">IMateFeatureData</see> is the parent of this advanced mate interface. To create a symmetry mate:
Follow general instructions in the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate">IAssemblyDoc::CreateMate</see> Remarks. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISymmetricMateFeatureData.EntitiesToMate">ISymmetricMateFeatureData::EntitiesToMate</see> or use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> to pre-select the entities using Mark = 1. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISymmetricMateFeatureData.SymmetryPlane">ISymmetricMateFeatureData::SymmetryPlane</see> or use IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2 to pre-select the symmetry plane using Mark = 4. Specify other properties of the SymmetricMateFeatureData object as required. To edit a symmetry mate:
Access its feature and call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetDefinition">IFeature::GetDefinition</see> to get the MateFeatureData object. Cast the MateFeatureData object to a SymmetricMateFeatureData object. Modify the SymmetricMateFeatureData object. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature::ModifyDefinition</see>. To delete a symmetry mate, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2">IModelDocExtension::DeleteSelection2</see>.

Type.Name: ITabAndSlotFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a tab and slot feature.

Type.Name: ITabAndSlotGroupData
Type.Description: Allows access to a tab and slot feature group.

Type.Name: ITableAnchor
Type.Description: Allows access to the data that defines a table anchor feature.

Example.Name: Get and Set Table Anchor of Hole Table
Get and Set Table Anchor of Hole Table
Get and Set Table Anchor of Hole Table

Type.Remarks: RemarksIf a table anchor is selected, then it can be retrieved with <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISelectionMgr.GetSelectedObject6">ISelectionMgr::GetSelectedObject6</see>. If the selected object type is swSelBOMTEMPS, then getting the selected object is a <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IFeature">IFeature</see> object. Use <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetSpecificFeature2">IFeature::GetSpecifiedFeature2</see> to return a TableAnchor object. If you traverse the features and subfeatures of a drawing, then the table anchors display as subfeatures of the sheet format. When <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetTypeName">IFeature::GetTypeName</see> returns GeneralTableAnchor, HoleTableAnchor, WeldmentCutListAnchor, RevisionTableAnchor, or BomTemplate, use IFeature::GetSpecificFeature2 to return a ITableAnchor object. NOTE: Weld table anchors are not currently supported. You can also retrieve a ITableAnchor object from the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISheet">ISheet</see> object using <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISheet.TableAnchor">ISheet::TableAnchor</see>. There is only one anchor of each type on a sheet format.

Type.Name: ITableAnnotation
Type.Description: Provides access to table annotations.

Example.Name: Hide or Show First Column in Hole Table
Hide or Show First Column in Hole Table
Hide or Show First Column in Hole Table
Get Components in Each BOM Table Row
Get Components in Each BOM Table Row

Type.Remarks: RemarksSee <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swTableAnnotationType_e">swTableAnnotationType_e</see> for the types of tables derived from ITableAnnotation.

Type.Name: ITablePatternFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a table-driven pattern feature.

Example.Name: Get Points of Repeating Elements in Table-driven Pattern
Get Points of Repeating Elements in Table-driven Pattern
Get Points of Repeating Elements in Table-driven Pattern

Type.Remarks:
RemarksRead <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/Pattern_Features_and_their_Feature_Data_Objects.htm">Pattern Features and their Feature Data Objects</see>. Before calling IFeatureManager::CreateDefinition, you must pre-select the entities needed to create the table-driven pattern feature.
To select... Use mark...
Seed feature 4
Coordinate system 16
Reference point 32
Seed face 128
Seed body 256 You must call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.CreateFeature">IFeatureManager::CreateFeature</see> after initializing this feature data object in order to successfully create the table-driven pattern. See the Table Driven Patterns topic in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help for more information about table-driven patterns.

Type.Name: ITangentMateFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a tangent mate feature.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksA tangent mate:
Places selected items tangent to one another. Must have at least one cylindrical, conical, or spherical item. <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMateFeatureData">IMateFeatureData</see> is the parent of this mate interface. To create a tangent mate:
Follow general instructions in the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate">IAssemblyDoc::CreateMate</see> Remarks. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ITangentMateFeatureData.EntitiesToMate">ITangentMateFeatureData::EntitiesToMate</see> or use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> to pre-select the entities to mate using Mark = 1. Specify other properties of the TangentMateFeatureData object. To edit a tangent mate:
Access its feature and call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetDefinition">IFeature::GetDefinition</see> to get the MateFeatureData object. Cast the MateFeatureData object to a TangentMateFeatureData object. Modify the TangentMateFeatureData object. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature::ModifyDefinition</see>. To delete this tangent mate, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2">IModelDocExtension::DeleteSelection2</see>.

Type.Name: ITaperedTapElementData
Type.Description: Allows access to the data of a tapered tap hole element in an Advanced Hole.
Type.Remarks: RemarksTo create an Advanced Hole feature, see the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.AdvancedHole">IFeatureManager::AdvancedHole</see> Remarks.

Type.Name: ITaskpaneView
Type.Description: Provides access to an application-level Task Pane.

Example.Name: Add .NET Controls to SOLIDWORKS using an Add-in
Add .NET Controls to SOLIDWORKS using an Add-in

Type.Remarks: RemarksEvents are implemented with delegates in the Microsoft .NET Framework. See the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks_namespace">Overview</see> topic for a list of delegates for this interface.

Type.Name: ITessellation
Type.Description: Used to gather tessellation information from a SOLIDWORKS body.
Type.Remarks: RemarksAllows you to specify certain tolerances to adjust the information that is returned that describes the tessellation of this body.

Type.Name: ITextAndCustomProperty
Type.Description: Gains access to the text and custom properties in a <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMBD3DPdfData.ThemeName">theme</see> of a <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMBD3DPdfData">SOLIDWORKS MBD 3D PDF</see>.

Example.Name: Publish Text and Custom Properties from Theme to MBD 3D PDF
Publish Text and Custom Properties from Theme to MBD 3D PDF
Publish Text and Custom Properties from Theme to MBD 3D PDF

Type.Remarks:
RemarksSOLIDWORKS Model Based Definition (MBD) is an integrated drawingless manufacturing solution for SOLIDWORKS. Typical steps for generating a SOLIDWORKS MBD 3D PDF using the SOLIDWORKS API are:
Get the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMBD3DPdfData">MBD3DPdfData object</see> using <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.GetMBD3DPdfData">IModelDocExtension::GetMBD3DPdfData</see>. Set the path and file name of the SOLIDWORKS MBD 3D PDF theme using <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMBD3DPdfData.ThemeName">IMBD3DPdfData::ThemeName</see>. Get standard and custom views using <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMBD3DPdfData.GetStandardViews">IMBD3DPdfData::GetStandardViews</see> and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMBD3DPdfData.GetMoreViews">IMBD3DPdfData::GetMoreViews</see>. Set standard and custom views using <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMBD3DPdfData.SetStandardViews">IMBD3DPdfData::SetStandardViews</see> and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMBD3DPdfData.SetMoreViews">IMBD3DPdfData::SetMoreViews</see>. Get and set text and custom properties in the theme using the array of objects returned by this interface's accessor. See the

Type.Description: Allows access to a thicken feature.

Type.Name: IThreadFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a thread feature.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksThis interface:
Accesses the feature data for a thread created either inside a cylindrical hole or around a cylindrical rod. Is functionally similar to the Thread PropertyManager in the SOLIDWORKS Design user interface. To create a Thread feature, see <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/Thread_Features_and_ThreadFeatureData_Objects.htm">Thread Features and ThreadFeatureData Objects</see>. For more information, see the Thread PropertyManager topic in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help.

Type.Name: ITitleBlock
Type.Description: Allows access to the title block in this sheet.

Example.Name: Get Notes from New or Existing Title Block
Get Notes from New or Existing Title Block
Get Notes from New or Existing Title Block

Type.Remarks: RemarksOnly one title block feature can exist in a sheet.

Type.Name: ITitleBlockTableAnnotation
Type.Description: Provides access to title block table annotations.

Type.Name: ITitleBlockTableFeature
Type.Description: Provides access to title block table features.

Type.Name: IToolingSplitFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a tooling-split feature.

Type.Name: ITreeControlItem
Type.Description: Allows you to traverse items in the FeatureManager design tree exactly as they appear in the FeatureManager design tree.

Example.Name: Expand or Collapse FeatureManager Design Tree Nodes
Expand or Collapse FeatureManager Design Tree Nodes

Type.Remarks: RemarksITreeControlItem objects are released whenever the FeatureManager design tree is rebuilt (e.g., add or remove features, rebuild the model, etc.).

Type.Name: ITriadManipulator
Type.Description:
Allows access to triad manipulators, which are:
Similar to the SOLIDWORKS triad. Used to move and rotate assembly components, move/copy bodies, and so on.

Type.Name: ITwoMemberCornerTreatmentFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a two member corner treatment feature of a structure system.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksThis interface is:
derived from <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ICornerTreatmentFeatureData">ICornerTreatmentFeatureData</see>. valid only if <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ICornerTreatmentFeatureData.IgnoreCornerTreatment">ICornerTreatmentFeatureData::IgnoreCornerTreatment</see> is false. A two member corner is the position in a structure system where two members intersect. You can assign one member as a trim tool and use it to add or remove material from the other member. The trim tool member may be assigned to either member in a planar or body trim type. In the SOLIDWORKS Design user interface, the Two member Corner PropertyManager contains three lists that you can manage using the APIs in this interface and elsewhere:
<see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ICornerTreatmentGroupFolder.GetCornerTreatments">Corner groups</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ITwoMemberCornerTreatmentFeatureData.GetCornerGroupMembers">Corner group members</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ITwoMemberCornerTreatmentFeatureData.MiterTrimPlanePoint">Miter trim plane point</see> For more information, see:
SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help > Weldments and Structure System > Structure System > Corner Management SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help > Weldments and Structure System > Structure System > Two Member PropertyManager

Type.Name: IUniversalJointMateFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a universal joint mate feature.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksA universal joint (U-joint) mate consists of two components where the rotation of one component (the output shaft) about its axis is driven by the rotation of another component (the input shaft) about its axis. An example would be the U-joint between the transmission and the rear drive axle of an automobile. <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMateFeatureData">IMateFeatureData</see> is the parent of this mate interface. To create a universal joint mate:
Follow general instructions in the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate">IAssemblyDoc::CreateMate</see> Remarks. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IUniversalJointMateFeatureData.EntitiesToMate">IUniversalJointMateFeatureData::EntitiesToMate</see> or use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> to pre-select the entities using Mark = 1. Set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IUniversalJointMateFeatureData.DefineJointPoint">IUniversalJointMateFeatureData::DefineJointPoint</see> to true and specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IUniversalJointMateFeatureData.JointPoint">IUniversalJointMateFeatureData::JointPoint</see> or use IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2 to pre-select the joint point using Mark = 16384. Specify other properties of the UniversalJointMateFeatureData object as required. To edit a universal joint mate:
Access its feature and call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetDefinition">IFeature::GetDefinition</see> to get the MateFeatureData object. Cast the MateFeatureData object to a UniversalJointMateFeatureData object. Modify the UniversalJointMateFeatureData object. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature::ModifyDefinition</see>. To delete this universal joint mate, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2">IModelDocExtension::DeleteSelection2</see>.

Type.Name: IUserNotificationDefinition
Type.Description: Allows access to a user notification of an add-in.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksA user notification is an add-in dialog that:
Allows an add-in to display a unique message to SOLIDWORKS Design users. Is modeless. May appear within the context of a document open in its own frame or within SOLIDWORKS itself. Replaces any previously displayed user notification. Requires an IUserNotificationHandler to handle user notification events.

Type.Name: IUserNotificationHandler
Type.Description: Must be implemented by the add-in application to handle callbacks from <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IUserNotificationDefinition">IUserNotificationDefinition</see>.

Type.Name: IUserProgressBar
Type.Description: Allows access to a progress indicator that indicates how much longer a SOLIDWORKS operation will take.

Example.Name: Start, Update, and Stop Progress Indicator
Start, Update, and Stop Progress Indicator
Start, Update, and Stop Progress Indicator

Type.Remarks: RemarksThe progress indicator appears on the SOLIDWORKS status bar.

Type.Name: IUserUnit
Type.Description: Allows you to manage units.
Type.Remarks:
Remarks
If you obtain IUserUnit using... Then IUserUnit's properties are...
<see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDoc2">IModelDoc2</see> Read only and persistent. Use IModelDocExtension::SetUserPreference* methods to set the units properties of a document.
<see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks">ISldWorks</see> Read-write, but not persistent. The instance of IUserUnit returned by ISldWorks is empty and not tied to any document. Use this instance as a template to store units properties at runtime. NOTE: Use this interface instead of mo_UserUnits.h file in public_documents\appcomm of your SOLIDWORKS installation. If you previously used mo_UserUnits.h, you should change your applications to use this interface.

Type.Name: IVariableFilletFeatureData2
Type.Description: Allows access to a variable radius fillet feature.

Example.Name: Create Variable Radius Asymmetric Elliptical Fillet
Create Variable Radius Asymmetric Elliptical Fillet
Create Variable Radius Asymmetric Elliptical Fillet
Create Curvature Continuous Variable Fillet Feature
Create Curvature Continuous Variable Fillet Feature
Create Curvature Continuous Variable Fillet Feature

Type.Remarks:
RemarksTo create a variable fillet feature, follow the instructions in the Remarks section of <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.FeatureFillet3">IFeatureManager::FeatureFillet3</see>. To edit a variable fillet feature:
Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetDefinition">IFeature::GetDefinition</see>. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IVariableFilletFeatureData2.AccessSelections">IVariableFilletFeatureData2::AccessSelections</see>. Modify properties on this interface as needed and call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature::ModifyDefinition</see>. If nothing is modified, call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IVariableFilletFeatureData2.ReleaseSelectionAccess">IVariableFilletFeatureData2::ReleaseSelectionAccess</see>. For more information, read the Variable Size Fillets topic in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help.

Type.Name: IVertex
Type.Description: Represents the start or end of an <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IEdge">edge</see>.

Example.Name: Get Maximum Edge and Vertex Gaps
Get Maximum Edge and Vertex Gaps
Get Maximum Edge and Vertex Gaps

Type.Remarks: RemarksThis interface allows you to get the associated edges in an enumerated list or the coordinates of the vertex.

Type.Name: IView
Type.Description: Represents drawing views found in a drawing document.

Example.Name: Get Drawing View Names and Types
Reposition Drawing Views to Avoid Overlap
Get Notes from New or Existing Title Block
Get Notes from New or Existing Title Block
Get Notes from New or Existing Title Block

Type.Remarks: RemarksA drawing document can consist of one or more drawing sheets. Each drawing sheet typically contains one or more drawing views. Each drawing view is an oriented snapshot of a particular SOLIDWORKS model and a particular configuration of the model. The IView object lets you determine the particular model and configuration being viewed and to get information about all the objects in a drawing sheet or drawing view, as well as the drawing view bounds, and transforms.

Type.Name: IView3D
Type.Description: Allows access to a 3D View of a part or assembly.
Type.Remarks: RemarksThis interface supports SOLIDWORKS Model Based Definition (MBD), which is an integrated drawingless manufacturing solution for SOLIDWORKS. Use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.LoadAddIn">ISldWorks::LoadAddIn</see> to load the MBD add-in. See the SOLIDWORKS Help for details about MBD.

Type.Name: IWeldBead
Type.Description: Allows access to weld bead annotations.

Type.Name: IWeldSymbol
Type.Description: Allows access to weld symbols.

Type.Name: IWeldmentBeadFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a weldment bead feature.
Type.Remarks: RemarksA bead can be applied to two sides: arrow or other. All of these methods and properties use one of these sides as input. A staggered type of weld bead requires applying the weld bead to both sides.

Type.Name: IWeldmentCutListAnnotation
Type.Description: Allows access to the annotations in a <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IWeldmentCutListFeature">weldment cut list</see> table.

Type.Name: IWeldmentCutListFeature
Type.Description: Allows access to a weldment cut list feature.

Example.Name: Get Weldment Cut List Feature and Annotations
Get Weldment Cut List Feature and Annotations
Get Weldment Cut List Feature and Annotations

Type.Name: IWeldmentTrimExtendFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to the data that defines a weldment trim extend feature.

Example.Name: Get Weldment Trim Extend Corner Type
Get Weldment Trim Extend Corner Type
Get Weldment Trim Extend Corner Type

Type.Remarks: RemarksOnly bodies created by weldment features can be trimmed and extended. Only End Trim corner types can have multiple target and boundary bodies to trim. All other corner types can have only one target and boundary body to trim. For all other corner types, first valid body specified is used if more than one body is specified.

Type.Name: IWidthMateFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to width mate feature data.
Type.Remarks:
Remarks A width mate constrains a tab between two planar faces. <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMateFeatureData">IMateFeatureData</see> is the parent of this advanced mate interface. To create a width mate:
Follow general instructions in the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate">IAssemblyDoc::CreateMate</see> Remarks. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IWidthMateFeatureData.TabSelection">IWidthMateFeatureData::TabSelection</see> or use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> to pre-select the tab using Mark = 16. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IWidthMateFeatureData.WidthSelection">IWidthMateFeatureData::WidthSelection</see> or use IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2 to pre-select the width using Mark = 1. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IWidthMateFeatureData.ConstraintType">IWidthMateFeatureData::ConstraintType</see>. Specify other properties of the WidthMateFeatureData object as required. To edit a width mate:
Access its feature and call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetDefinition">IFeature::GetDefinition</see> to get the MateFeatureData object. Cast the MateFeatureData object to a WidthMateFeatureData object. Modify the WidthMateFeatureData object. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature::ModifyDefinition</see>. To delete a width mate, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2">IModelDocExtension::DeleteSelection2</see>.

For example, if the annotation's visibility is set to swAnnotationHalfHidden by <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IAnnotation.Visible">IAnnotation::Visible</see>, then that annotation is in a half-hidden state, which is not a permanent state. During a Hide/Show Annotations operation in a drawing, a half-hidden annotation is displayed in gray if the interactive user selects to show all annotations. Any annotation set to swAnnotationHalfHidden is hidden when the interactive user finishes using Hide/Show Annotations.

Type.Name: swAppNotify_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Application notifications.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksTo receive notifications, a DLL application must register for the notifications by object type. This registration must be done for each instance of a particular object. For example, in the file in the Visual C++ 6.0 wizard-generated add-in that supports SOLIDWORKS events ( ATL_object_name>.h), include:
BEGIN_SINK_MAP(CTL_object_name>) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_SLDWORKS_EVENTS, DIID_DSldWorksEvents, swAppDocumentLoadNotify, DocumentLoadNotify) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_SLDWORKS_EVENTS, DIID_DSldWorksEvents, swAppFileNewNotify2, FileNewNotify2) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_SLDWORKS_EVENTS, DIID_DSldWorksEvents, swAppActiveDocChangeNotify, ActiveDocChangeNotify) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_SLDWORKS_EVENTS, DIID_DSldWorksEvents, swAppActiveModelDocChangeNotify, ActiveModelDocChangeNotify) END_SINK_MAP()
If developing a C++ application, use the enumerators to <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/events.htm">register for notifications</see> for the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks">ISldWorks</see> events.

Member.Name: swAppFileNewNotify2
Member.Description: 12 = <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.DSldworksEvents_FileNewNotify2EventHandler">FileNewNotify2</see> NOTE: Because it is possible to have a NULL active document when an add-in is notified using swAppFileOpenNotify2, use <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.IGetOpenDocumentByName2">ISldWorks::IGetOpenDocumentByName2</see> instead of <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.IActiveDoc2">ISldWorks::IActiveDoc2</see>.

Type.Remarks:
RemarksThese enumerator options are used by <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IBomTableSortData.ItemGroups">IBomTableSortData::ItemGroups</see> to set the groupings for table sorting. For example, when you set IBomTableSortData::ItemGroups to the following array, assemblies are grouped first, parts are grouped second, and other categories are grouped last:
<see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swBomTableSortItemGroup_e">swBomTableSortItemGroup_e</see>.swBomTableSortItemGroup_Assemblies <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swBomTableSortItemGroup_e">swBomTableSortItemGroup_e</see>.swBomTableSortItemGroup_Parts <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swBomTableSortItemGroup_e">swBomTableSortItemGroup_e</see>.swBomTableSortItemGroup_Other

Type.Name: swBoundType_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Boundary behaviors at the start and end of UV parameter ranges.
Type.Remarks: RemarksIf the behavior at the start of the U range is Degenerate', then the V parameter is degenerate when U = urange[0]'. The derivative of the parameterization function with respect to v is 0 whenever u = urange[0]', for all values of v, and the parameter curve corresponding to u = urange[0]' degenerates to a single point. A parameterization can only degenerate at the end of its range, unless the surface is a B-spline surface.

Member.Description: 13736 = Not continuously differentiable across the boundary.

Type.Name: swDrawingNotify_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Drawing notifications.
Type.Remarks: RemarksTo receive notifications, a DLL application must register for the notifications by object type. This registration must be done for each instance of a particular object. For example, in the file in the Visual C++ 6.0 wizard-generated add-in that supports drawing events (e.g., Drawing.h), include: BEGIN_SINK_MAP(CSwDrawing) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_DRAWINGDOC_EVENTS, DIID_DDrawingDocEvents, swDrawingDestroyNotify, DestroyNotify) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_DRAWINGDOC_EVENTS, DIID_DDrawingDocEvents, swDrawingNewSelectionNotify, NewSelectionNotify) END_SINK_MAP() If developing a C++ application, use the enumerators to <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/events.htm">register for notifications</see> for <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IDrawingDoc">IDrawingDoc</see> events.

Type.Remarks: RemarksTo receive notifications, a DLL application must register for the notifications by object type. This registration must be done for each instance of a particular object. For example, in the file in the Visual C++ 6.0 wizard-generated add-in that supports FeatureManager design tree events (e.g., FeatMgrView.h), include: DECLARE_REGISTRY_RESOURCEID(IDR_FeatMgrView) BEGIN_SINK_MAP(CFeatMgrView) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_FEATMGRVIEW_EVENTS, DIID_DFeatMgrViewEvents, swFMViewDestroyNotify , DestroyNotify) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_FEATMGRVIEW_EVENTS, DIID_DFeatMgrViewEvents, swFMViewActivateNotify, ActivateNotify) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_FEATMGRVIEW_EVENTS, DIID_DFeatMgrViewEvents, swFMViewDeactivateNotify , DeActivateNotify) END_SINK_MAP() If developing a C++ application, use these enumerators to <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/events.htm">register for notifications</see> for <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IFeatMgrView">IFeatMgrView</see> events.

Member.Description: 66 = Some edges form closed loops; partial edge fillet does not support closed loops

Member.Name: swFeatureErrorPartialEdgeFilletOffsetTooBig
Member.Description: 58 = The fillet offset is too large

Member.Name: swFeatureErrorPartialEdgeFilletUpdateFailed
Member.Description: 53 = Failed to update the partial edge data

Type.Name: swFeatureFillSurfaceOptions_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Feature fill surface options. <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/bitmasks.htm">Bitmask</see>.
Type.Remarks: RemarksSome options might not work because the topology of the surface fill to be created might not permit them. In these cases, the options are ignored.

Type.Name: swFeatureFilletOptions_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Fillet/chamfer options. <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/bitmasks.htm">Bitmask</see>.

Member.Name: swFeatureFilletAsymmetric
Member.Description: 16384 or 0x4000; requires that you specify Direction 1 and Direction 2 radii for the asymmetric sides of the fillet/chamfer

Member.Name: swFeatureFilletAttachEdges
Member.Description: 64 or 0x40; set to fillet attached edges between intersecting features; you must pre-select the features

Member.Name: swFeatureFilletConstantWidth
Member.Description: 512 or 0x200; set to create a face fillet of constant width

Member.Name: swFeatureFilletCurvatureContinuous
Member.Description: 256 or 0x100; set to create a smoother curvature between adjacent surfaces; overrides any other cross-sectional profile setting

Member.Name: swFeatureFilletKeepFeatures
Member.Description: 128 or 0x80; set to keep cut or boss features visible if you apply a fillet radius large enough to cover them

Member.Name: swFeatureFilletNoTrimNoAttached
Member.Description: 1024 or 0x400; set to trim the filleted faces and knit the surfaces into one surface body

Member.Name: swFeatureFilletPropagate
Member.Description: 1 or 0x1; set to extend the fillet to all faces that are tangent to the selected face

Member.Name: swFeatureFilletUniformRadius
Member.Description: 2 or 0x2; set for a uniform radius; do not set for multiple radii

Member.Name: swFeatureFilletUseHelpPoint
Member.Description: 8 or 0x8; valid only for face fillets/chamfers, set to disambiguate placement of the face fillet/chamfer; requires that you specify a vertex close to where the face blend should occur

Member.Name: swFeatureFilletUseTangentHoldLine
Member.Description: 16 or 0x10; set to create a face hold line fillet whose shape is to be determined by a specified part edge or a face projected split line; the radius of the fillet is driven by the distance between the hold line and edge fo fillet

Member.Name: swFeatureFilletVarRadiusType
Member.Description: 4 or 0x4; set to create a straight transition fillet that changes from one radius to another linearly while matching edge tangency to an adjacent fillet; do not set to create a smooth transition fillet that changes smoothly from one radius to another when matching edge tangency to an adjacent fillet

Type.Name: swFeatureFilletProfileType_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Fillet cross-sectional profile shapes.

Member.Name: swFeatureFilletCircular
Member.Description: 0 = Circular for symmetric fillets; elliptical for asymmetric fillets

Member.Name: swFeatureFilletConicRadius
Member.Description: 2 = Requires that you set the radius of curvature at the shoulder point along the fillet's cross section

Member.Name: swFeatureFilletConicRho
Member.Description: 1 = Requires that you set a ratio in the range [0.5, 0.95] which indicates the weight of the cross-section

Type.Name: swFileLoadError_e Enumeration
Type.Description: File load errors. <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/bitmasks.htm">Bitmask</see>.

Member.Name: swAddinInteruptError
Member.Description: 1048576 or 0x100000: The user attempted to open a file, and then interrupted the open-file routine to open a different file

Member.Name: swApplicationBusy
Member.Description: 8388608 or 0x800000: File open is blocked when application is busy

Member.Name: swFileCriticalDataRepairError
Member.Description: 4194304 or 0x400000 = A document has critical data corruption

Member.Name: swFileNotFoundError
Member.Description: 2 or 0x2 = Unable to locate the file; the file is not loaded or the referenced file (that is, component) is suppressed

Member.Name: swFileRequiresRepairError
Member.Description: 2097152 or 0x200000 = A document has non-critical custom property data corruption

Member.Name: swFileWithSameTitleAlreadyOpen
Member.Description: 65536 or 0x10000 = A document with the same name is already open

Member.Name: swFutureVersion
Member.Description: 8192 or 0x2000 = The document was saved in a future version of SOLIDWORKS

Member.Name: swInvalidFileTypeError
Member.Description: 1024 or 0x400 = File type argument is not valid

Member.Name: swLiquidMachineDoc
Member.Description: 131072 or 0x20000 = File encrypted by Liquid Machines

Member.Name: swLowResourcesError
Member.Description: 262144 or 0x40000 = File is open and blocked because the system memory is low, or the number of GDI handles has exceeded the allowed maximum

Member.Name: swNoDisplayData
Member.Description: 524288 or 0x80000 = File contains no display data

Type.Name: swFileLoadWarning_e Enumeration
Type.Description: File load warnings for <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.OpenDoc6">ISldWorks::OpenDoc6</see>. <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/bitmasks.htm">Bitmask</see>.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_AlreadyOpen
Member.Description: 128 or 0x80 = Warning appears because the document is already open.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_AutomaticRepair
Member.Description: 262144 or 0x40000 = Warning appears that non-critical data in the document was automatically repaired.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_BasePartNotLoaded
Member.Description: 64 or 0x40 = Warning appears because the document was defined in the context of another existing document that is not loaded.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_ComponentMissingReferencedConfig
Member.Description: 32768 or 0x8000 = Warning appears if document is opened silently and swOpenDocOptions_AutoMissingConfig is specified.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_CriticalDataRepair
Member.Description: 524288 or 0x80000 = Warning appears that critical data in the document was automatically repaired.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_DimensionsReferencedIncorrectlyToModels
Member.Description: 16384 or 0x4000 = Warning appears because some dimensions are referenced to the models incorrectly; these dimensions are highlighted in red in the drawing.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_DrawingANSIUpdate
Member.Description: 8 or 0x8 = Warning appears because radial dimension arrows now displayed outside when the dimension text is outside of the arc or circle.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_DrawingSFSymbolConvert
Member.Description: 2048 or 0x800Warning appears asking the user if he or she wants to convert this drawing's surface finish symbols to the sizes specified in ANSI Y14.36M-1996 and ISO 1302-1978.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_DrawingsOnlyRapidDraft
Member.Description: 256 or 0x100 = Warning appears because the only RapidDraft format conversion that can take place is a drawing document that is not Detached.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_IdMismatch
Member.Description: 1 or 0x1 = Warning appears if the internal ID of the document does not match the internal ID saved with the referencing document.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_InvisibleDoc_LinkedDesignTableUpdateFail
Member.Description: 65536 or 0x10000 = Warning issued because an attempt has been made to open an invisible document with a linked design table that was modified externally, and the design table cannot be updated because the document cannot be displayed; you must make the document visible to open it and update the design table.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_MissingDesignTable
Member.Description: 131072 or 0x20000 = Warning appears because the design table is missing.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_MissingExternalReferences
Member.Description: 1048576 or 0x100000 = Warning appears if one or more references are missing when loading a file.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_ModelOutOfDate
Member.Description: 8192 or 0x2000 = Warning appears because some sheets contain drawing views that are out of date with their external models.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_NeedsRegen
Member.Description: 32 or 0x20 = Warning appears because the document needs to be rebuilt.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_ReadOnly
Member.Description: 2 or 0x2 = Warning appears because the document is read only.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_RevolveDimTolerance
Member.Description: 4096 or 0x1000 = Warning appears because some of the tolerances of the revolved feature dimensions were created in SOLIDWORKS 99 or earlier and are not synchronized with their corresponding dimensions in the sketch.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_SharingViolation
Member.Description: 4 or 0x4 = Warning appears if the document is being used by another user.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_SheetScaleUpdate
Member.Description: 16 or 0x10 = Warning appears because SOLIDWORKS now applies the scale of the sheet to the sketch entities on the sheet; which means that the sheet looks the same but dimension values are scaled.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_ViewMissingReferencedConfig
Member.Description: 1024 or 0x400 = Warning appears because a configuration that a drawing view is referencing no longer exists in the model (part or assembly); the active configuration is used.

Member.Name: swFileLoadWarning_ViewOnlyRestrictions
Member.Description: 512 or 0x200 = Warning appears because the document is view only and a configuration other than the default configuration is set.

Type.Name: swFileSaveError_e Enumeration
Type.Description: File save errors. <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/bitmasks.htm">Bitmask</see>.
Type.Remarks: RemarksNot all of these return codes are fatal errors. The return code is a bitmask of different conditions that can occur during the operation, some of which are fatal and some are informational or warnings.

Member.Name: swFileNameContainsAtSign
Member.Description: 8 or 0x8 = File name cannot contain the at symbol (@)

Member.Name: swFileNameEmpty
Member.Description: 4 or 0x4 = File name cannot be empty

Member.Name: swFileSaveAsDetachedDrawingsNotSupported
Member.Description: 16384 or 0x4000 = Detached drawing save as options is not supported

Member.Name: swFileSaveAsDoNotOverwrite
Member.Description: 128 or 0x80 = Do not overwrite an existing file

Member.Name: swFileSaveAsInvalidFileExtension
Member.Description: 256 or 0x100 = File name extension does not match the SOLIDWORKS document type

Member.Name: swFileSaveAsNameExceedsMaxPathLength
Member.Description: 2048 or 0x800 = File name cannot exceed 255 characters

Member.Name: swFileSaveAsNoSelection
Member.Description: 512 or 0x200 = Save the selected bodies in a part document. Valid option for <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPartDoc.SaveToFile2">IPartDoc::SaveToFile2</see>; however, not a valid option for <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SaveAs">IModelDocExtension::SaveAs</see>

Member.Name: swFileSaveAsNotSupported
Member.Description:
4096 or 0x1000 = Save As operation:
is not supported was executed is such a way that the resulting file might not be complete, possibly because SOLIDWORKS is hidden; if the error persists after <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.Visible">setting SOLIDWORKS to visible</see> and re-attempting the Save As operation, contact SOLIDWORKS API support.

Member.Name: swFileSaveFormatNotAvailable
Member.Description: 32 or 0x20 = Save As file type is not valid

Member.Name: swFileSaveRequiresSavingReferences
Member.Description: 8192 or 0x2000 = Saving an assembly with renamed components requires saving the references

These warnings do not cause the File, Save operation to fail. <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/bitmasks.htm">Bitmask</see>.

Type.Name: swFilletOverFlowType_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Fillet overflow types.

Member.Name: swFilletOverFlowType_Default
Member.Description: 0 = Default; system picks the appropriate method to create a fillet when the fillet surface overflows to adjacent surfaces; it either smoothly blends with adjacent surfaces or limits the fillet surface with the adjacent edges, thereby not changing the edge, or trims the fillet surface by the adjacent surface onto which the fillet overflows; the method actually used by default depending on the geometric condition; this option always tries to create a fillet if possible

Member.Name: swFilletOverFlowType_KeepEdge
Member.Description: 1 = Edges that are overflowed by the fillet are not modified; the fillet surface is trimmed by all the adjacent edges; as a result, an additional transition fillet surface might be needed to complete the fillet

Member.Name: swFilletOverFlowType_KeepSurface
Member.Description: 2 = Fillet surface is either merged with the adjacent surfaces smoothly or trimmed by the adjacent surfaces; as a result, it is unlikely that an additional transition fillet surface is created

Member.Description: 3 = Flange length is measured from the edge flange face to a line that is tangent to the bend; not valid for the Up To Edge And Merge length end condition

Member.Name: swFlangeDimTypeInnerVirtualSharp
Member.Description: 2 = Flange length is measured from the edge flange face to an inner virtual sharp (sketch point at the virtual intersection point of two sketch entities)

Member.Name: swFlangeDimTypeOuterVirtualSharp
Member.Description: 1 = Flange length is measured from the edge flange face to an outer virtual sharp (sketch point at the virtual intersection point of two sketch entities)

Type.Name: swFlangeOffsetTypes_e Enumeration

Member.Name: swFlangeOffsetBlind
Member.Description: 1 = Positions the edge flange based on the length and direction you specify

Member.Name: swFlangeOffsetUptoEdgeAndMerge
Member.Description: 6 = Creates the edge flange in a multibody part by merging a selected edge on one body with an Up To reference edge on the second body

Member.Name: swFlangeOffsetUpToVertex
Member.Description: 2 = Positions the edge flange up to a specified vertex; for flange length, the selected vertex may be either on a plane that is normal to the end face of the edge flange or on a plane that is parallel to the face of the base flange

Type.Name: swFlangePositionTypes_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Position types for sheet metal edge flanges.

Member.Name: swFlangePositionTypeBendTangent
Member.Description: 6 = The flange position will always be tangent to the side face attached to the selected edge, and the flange length will always maintain the exact length; not valid for the Up To Edge And Merge length end condition

Member.Name: swAlwaysAttachToBalloon
Member.Description:
0x1004 or 4100 = <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/bitmasks.htm">Bitmask</see>; applies only to balloon annotations; specifies that the balloon's Always Attach to Balloon leader option is enabled and the leader is always attached to the balloon when quantity is specified, and the balloon's Break Around leader option is disabled; if not specified, then the balloon's Always Attach to Balloon leader option is disabled, and the balloon's Break Around leader option is enabled and the balloon's leader is set to break around quantity; AND with one of the following options:
swBENT swSTRAIGHT swUNDERLINED (parts only) swSPLINE (drawings only) swVDA

Member.Name: swAttachLeaderBottom
Member.Description:
0x400 or 1024 = Bitmask; in part's multiline note, attaches leader to bottom of note; AND with one of the following options:
swBENT swSTRAIGHT swUNDERLINED

Member.Name: swAttachLeaderCenter
Member.Description:
0x200 or 512 = Bitmask; in a part's multiline note, attaches leader to center of note; AND with one of the following options:
swBENT swSTRAIGHT swUNDERLINED

Member.Name: swAttachLeaderNearest
Member.Description:
0x800 or 2048 = Bitmask; in a part's multiline note, left leader attaches to the top of note and right leader attaches to the bottom of note; AND with one of the following options:
swBENT swSTRAIGHT swUNDERLINED

Member.Name: swAttachLeaderTop
Member.Description:
0x100 or 256 = Bitmask; in a part's multiline note, attaches leader to top of note; AND with one of the following options:
swBENT swSTRAIGHT swUNDERLINED

Member.Name: swSPLINE
Member.Description: 4 = Creates a spline leader from a note; for drawings only

Member.Name: swUNDERLINED
Member.Description: 3 = Creates an underlined leader; for parts only

Type.Name: swMouseNotify_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Mouse notifications.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksTo receive notifications, a DLL application must register for the notifications by object type. This registration must be done for each instance of a particular object. For example, in the file in the Visual C++ 6.0 wizard-generated add-in that supports mouse events (e.g., Mouse.h), include:
DECLARE_REGISTRY_RESOURCEID(IDR_MOUSE) BEGIN_SINK_MAP(CMouse) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_MOUSE_EVENTS, DIID_DMouseEvents, swMouseMoveNotify, MouseMoveNotify) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_MOUSE_EVENTS, DIID_DMouseEvents, swMouseSelectNotify, MouseSelectNotify) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_MOUSE_EVENTS, DIID_DMouseEvents, swMouseLBtnDownNotify, MouseLBtnDownNotify) END_SINK_MAP()
If developing a C++ application, use these enumerators to <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/events.htm">register for notifications</see> for the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IMouse">IMouse</see> events.

Member.Description: 8192 or 0x2000; Open assembly using an advanced configuration

Member.Name: swOpenDocOptions_AutoMissingConfig
Member.Description: 32 or 0x20 = Obsolete; do not use The software automatically uses the last-used configuration of a model when it discovers missing configurations or component references as it silently opens drawings and assemblies.

Member.Name: swOpenDocOptions_DontLoadHiddenComponents
Member.Description: 256 or 0x100 = By default, hidden components are loaded when you open an assembly document. Set swOpenDocOptions_DontLoadHiddenComponents to not load hidden components when opening an assembly document

Member.Description: 2048 or 0x800 = Open in Large Design Review (resolved) mode with edit assembly enabled; use in combination with swOpenDocOptions_ViewOnly

Member.Name: swOpenDocOptions_LoadExternalReferencesInMemory
Member.Description: 512 or 0x200 = Open external references in memory only; this setting is valid only if <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swconst.swUserPreferenceIntegerValue_e">swUserPreferenceIntegerValue_e</see>.swLoadExternalReferences is not set to <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swconst.swLoadExternalReferences_e">swLoadExternalReferences_e</see>.swLoadExternalReferences_None <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swconst.swUserPreferenceToggle_e">swUserPreferenceToggle_e.swExtRefLoadRefDocsInMemory</see> (System Options > External References > Load documents in memory only) is ignored when opening documents through the API because <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IDocumentSpecification.LoadExternalReferencesInMemory">IDocumentSpecification::LoadExternalReferencesInMemory</see> and <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.OpenDoc6">ISldWorks::OpenDoc6</see> (swOpenDocOptions_e.swOpenDocOptions_LoadExternalReferencesInMemory) have sole control of reference loading

Member.Name: swOpenDocOptions_LoadLightweight
Member.Description: 128 or 0x80 = Open assembly document as lightweight NOTE: The default for whether an assembly document is opened lightweight is based on a registry setting accessed via Tools, Options, Assemblies or with the user preference setting swAutoLoadPartsLightweightTo override the default and specify a value with <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.OpenDoc6">ISldWorks::OpenDoc6</see>, set swOpenDocOptions_OverrideDefaultLoadLightweight. If set, then you can set swOpenDocOptions_LoadLightweight to open an assembly document as lightweight

Member.Name: swOpenDocOptions_LoadModel
Member.Description: 16 or 0x10 = Load Detached model upon opening document (drawings only)

Member.Name: swOpenDocOptions_OpenDetailingMode
Member.Description: 1024 or 0x400 = Open document in detailing mode

Member.Name: swOpenDocOptions_OverrideDefaultLoadLightweight
Member.Description: 64 or 0x40 = Override default setting whether to open an assembly document as lightweight

Member.Name: swOpenDocOptions_RapidDraft
Member.Description: 8 or 0x8 = Convert document to Detached format (drawings only)

Member.Name: swOpenDocOptions_SpeedPak
Member.Description: 4096 or 0x1000 = Open document using the SpeedPak option

Member.Name: swOpenDocOptions_ViewOnly
Member.Description: 4 or 0x4 = Open document in Large Design Review mode (assemblies only)

Type.Name: swPartNotify_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Part notifications.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksTo receive notifications, a DLL application must register for the notifications by object type. This registration must be done for each instance of a particular object. For example: For example, in the file in the Visual C++ 6.0 wizard-generated add-in that supports part events (e.g., PartDoc.h), include:
BEGIN_SINK_MAP(CSwPart) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_PARTDOC_EVENTS, DIID_DPartDocEvents, swPartDestroyNotify, DestroyNotify) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_PARTDOC_EVENTS, DIID_DPartDocEvents, swPartNewSelectionNotify, NewSelectionNotify) END_SINK_MAP()
If developing a C++ application, use these enumerators to <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/events.htm">register for notifications</see> for <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPartDoc">IPartDoc</see> events.

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageComboBoxStyle_AvoidSelectionText
Member.Description: 8 or 0x8; The item the user selects in the attached drop-down list does not appear in the combo box. Instead, the user's selection causes the add-in to get a callback via <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swpublished.IPropertyManagerPage2Handler4.OnComboboxSelectionChanged">IPropertyManagerPage2Handler4::OnComboboxSelectionChanged</see>. The Id argument is the combo box

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageComboBoxStyle_EditableText
Member.Description: 2 or 0x2; Allows editing of the text in the combo box

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageComboBoxStyle_EditBoxReadOnly
Member.Description: 4 or 0x4; User can only select a value from the attached drop-down list for the combo box NOTE: You can set swPropMgrPageComboBoxStyle_EditBoxReadOnly either before or after the PropertyManager page is displayed. If set after the PropertyManager page is displayed and the box contains editable text, then that text cannot be edited by the user. However, you can use <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPageCombobox.EditText">IPropertyManagerPageCombobox::EditText</see> to edit the text in the combo box.

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageComboBoxStyle_Sorted
Member.Description: 1 or 0x1; Sort the items in the attached drop-down list of the combo box in alphabetical order
