Type.Name: swPropMgrPageNumberBoxStyle_e Enumeration
Type.Description: PropertyManager page number box styles. <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/bitmasks.htm">Bitmask</see>.
Type.Remarks: RemarksWhen the user selects an item in the attached drop-down list, SOLIDWORKS attempts to use that item as a value in the number box. Thus, the items in the attached drop-down list should be numeric values and optionally include their units. The add-in then gets a callback via IPropertyManagerPage2Handler9::OnNumberboxChanged as if the user had typed a value in the number box or clicked the up-arrow or down-arrow buttons to increment or decrement the value. If you do not want your add-in to directly use items in the attached drop-down list in the number box, but instead want it to react to the user selecting a computed or linked value in the number box, then use swPropMgrPageNumberBoxStyle_AvoidSelectionText.

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageNumberBoxStyle_AvoidSelectionText
Member.Description: 4 or 0x4; The item the user selects in the attached drop-down list does not appear in the number box. Instead, the user's selection causes the add-in to get a callback via <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swpublished.IPropertyManagerPage2Handler9.OnComboboxSelectionChanged">IPropertyManagerPage2Handler9::OnComboboxSelectionChanged</see>; the Id argument will be the number box; the add-in is expected to respond by setting the value for the number box using <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPageNumberbox.Value">IPropertyManagerPageNumberbox::Value</see>.

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageNumberBoxStyle_ComboEditBox
Member.Description: 1 or 0x1; Enables the attached drop-down list for the number box; user can type a value or select a value from the attached drop-down list for the number box

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageNumberBoxStyle_EditBoxReadOnly
Member.Description: 2 or 0x2; User can only select a value from the attached drop-down list for the number box NOTE: You can set swPropMgrPageNumberBoxStyle_EditBoxReadOnly either before or after the PropertyManager page is displayed. If set after the PropertyManager page is displayed and the number box contains editable text, then that text cannot be edited by the user

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageNumberBoxStyle_NoScrollArrows
Member.Description: 8 or 0x8; Do not show the up and down arrows in the number box, thus, disallowing incrementing or decrementing the value in the number box

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageNumberBoxStyle_SuppressNotifyWhileTracking
Member.Description: 64 or 0x40; Suppress sending multiple notifications when a user is dragging or spinning the slider of a number box on a PropertyManager page; instead, send only one notification; see <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swpublished.IPropertyManagerPage2Handler9.OnNumberboxChanged">IPropertyManagerPage2Handler9::OnNumberboxChanged</see> for details

Type.Name: swPropMgrPageOptionStyle_e Enumeration
Type.Description: PropertyManage page group option styles. <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/bitmasks.htm">Bitmask</see>.

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageOptionStyle_FirstInGroup
Member.Description: 1 or 0x1; This is the beginning of a group of option items; any following option items without this value set are considered part of the group; the next option with this value set indicates the start of a new option group

Type.Name: swPropMgrPageSelectionBoxStyle_e Enumeration
Type.Description: PropertyManager page selection box styles. <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/bitmasks.htm">Bitmask</see>.

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageSelectionBoxStyle_HScroll
Member.Description: 1 or 0x1; Specifies that the selection box has a scroll bar so that interactive users can scroll through the list of items

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageSelectionBoxStyle_MultipleItemSelect
Member.Description: 4 or 0x4; Specifies that you can select multiple items in the selection box

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageSelectionBoxStyle_UpAndDownButtons
Member.Description: 2 or 0x2; Specifies that selection listbox has up and down arrows so that interactive users can move items in the list up or down

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageSelectionBoxStyle_WantListboxSelectionChanged
Member.Description: 8 or 0x8; Specifies that you want a notification sent when a user changes the selected item in a listbox or selection listbox

Type.Name: swPropMgrPageSliderStyle_e Enumeration
Type.Description: PropertyManager page slider styles. <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/bitmasks.htm">Bitmask</see>.

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageSliderStyle_AutoTicks
Member.Description: 2 or 0x2; If set, then tick marks are created based on swPropMgrPageSliderStyle_BottomLeftTicks and swPropMgrPageSliderStyle_TopRightTicks

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageSliderStyle_BottomLeftTicks
Member.Description: 4 or 0x4; If set, then tick marks appear at the bottom (horizontal) or left (vertical) of the slider

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageSliderStyle_NotifyWhileTracking
Member.Description: 16 or 0x10; If set, then your application is notified when the user is dragging the slider, each time the value changes; if not set, then your application is not notified when the user is dragging the slider, only when the user is done dragging the slider; setting this bit allows your application to react immediately to changes, but it does generate many more callbacks, so it is less efficient

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageSliderStyle_TopRightTicks
Member.Description: 8 or 0x8; If set, then tick marks appear at the top (horizontal) or right (vertical) of the slider

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageSliderStyle_Vertical
Member.Description: 1 or 0x1; If set, then the slider is oriented vertically; if not set, then the slider is oriented horizontally

Type.Name: swPropMgrPageTextBoxStyle_e Enumeration
Type.Description: PropertyManager page textbox styles. <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/bitmasks.htm">Bitmask</see>.

Member.Name: swPropMgrPageTextBoxStyle_NotifyOnlyWhenFocusLost
Member.Description: 1 or 0x1; Do not send notification every time a character in the text box changes; instead, only send notification when text box loses focus after the user has made all changes

Type.Name: swPropSheetType_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Property sheet types.
Type.Remarks: RemarksThis enumerator specifies possible values for the types of <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISWPropertySheet">ISWPropertySheet</see>s exported by SOLIDWORKS when a SldWorks notification of type <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swconst.swAppNotify_e">swAppPropertySheetCreateNotify</see> is sent. An example of a property sheet is the dialog that is displayed when you click Tools, Options. This dialog consists of a base property sheet and property pages stacked on top of it. To display a specific property page, click its tab.

Type.Remarks: RemarksThese enumerators describe themes for the various colors used in the PropertyManager pages, not a specific color. When a scheme is changed, any open PropertyManager pages are immediately updated to the new color scheme.

Member.Name: swPropertyManagerOptions_GrayOutDisabledSelectionListboxes

NOTE: Disabled selection list boxes should be hidden; graying them out is an exception to SOLIDWORKS standard practice.

Member.Name: swPropertyManagerOptions_SupportsChainSelection

131072 or 0x20000; If set, then show Select Chain:
on the shortcut menu if a sketch entity is currently selected. - or - if nothing is selected, but the cursor is over a sketch entity when the right-mouse button was clicked.

Member.Name: swPropertyManagerOptions_SupportsIsolate

Member.Name: swPropertyManagerPage_NoDocument
Member.Description: -2 = A PropertyManager page can only be shown in a SOLIDWORKS document window; you can create and set up the page without a document being active, but there must be a document active when you try to show the page; if there is no active document window, then swPropertyManagerPage_NoDocument is returned

Member.Name: swPropertyManagerPage_UnsupportedHandler
Member.Description: 1 = The PropertyManager page is created and shown; however, a problem exists; for example, you must specify the handler when you create the PropertyManager page; your add-in must implement <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swpublished.IPropertyManagerPage2Handler4">IPropertyManagerPage2Handler4</see> so that SOLIDWORKS can call back certain methods when operations, such as clicking a button, occur on the PropertyManager page;if the interface that is passed in does not support PropertyManagerPage2Handler4, then swPropertyManagerPage_UnsupportedHandler is returned

Type.Name: swPropertySheetNotify_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Property sheet notifications.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksTo receive notifications, a DLL application must register for the notifications by object type. This registration must be done for each instance of a particular object. For example, in the file in the Visual C++ 6.0 wizard-generated add-in that supports property sheet events ( e.g., SwPropertySheet.h), include:
BEGIN_SINK_MAP(CSwPropertySheet) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_SWPROPERTYSHEET_EVENTS, DIID_DSwPropertySheetEvents, swPropertySheetCreateControlNotify, CreateControlNotify) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_SWPROPERTYSHEET_EVENTS, DIID_DSwPropertySheetEvents, swPropertySheetDestroyNotify, DestroyNotify) END_SINK_MAP() If developing a C++ application, use these enumerators to <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/events.htm">register for notifications</see> for <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISWPropertySheet">ISWPropertySheet</see> events.

Type.Name: swSMBendState_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Bend state values for a sheet metal part.

Member.Name: swSMBendStateFlattened
Member.Description: 2 = The bends are flattened; the model is rolled back to just after a FlattenBends feature, but just before the corresponding ProcessBends feature

Member.Name: swSMBendStateFolded
Member.Description: 3 = The bends are folded; the model is rolled back to just after a FlattenBends ProcessBends feature pair

Member.Name: swSMBendStateNone
Member.Description: 0 = Not a sheet metal part; no SheetMetal features present

Member.Name: swSMBendStateSharps
Member.Description: 1 = The bends are in their sharp state; the part is rolled back to just before the first FlattenBends feature

Type.Name: swSMCommandStatus_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Return conditions for various sheet metal APIs that attempt to do set operations.

Member.Name: swSMErrorInvalidBendState
Member.Description: 4 = Failed, an invalid bend state was specified

Member.Name: swSMErrorNotAPart
Member.Description: 2 = Failed, sheet metal commands only apply to SOLIDWORKS parts

Member.Name: swSMErrorNotASheetMetalPart
Member.Description: 3 = Failed, the part contains no sheet metal features

Type.Name: swSaveAsOptions_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Save As options. <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/bitmasks.htm">Bitmask</see>.
Type.Remarks: RemarksThese options only apply to saving to native SOLIDWORKS file formats. For example, to export a SOLIDWORKS file to a VRML file format, use <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.GetUserPreferenceToggle">ISldWorks::GetUserPreferenceToggle</see> and <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.SetUserPreferenceToggle">ISldWorks::SetUserPreferenceToggle</see> with swExportVrmlAllComponentsInSingleFile.

Member.Name: swSaveAsOptions_Copy
Member.Description: 2 or 0x2; Save the document as a copy and continue editing

Member.Name: swSaveAsOptions_CopyAndOpen
Member.Description: 512 or 0x200; Save the document as a copy and open it

Member.Name: swSaveAsOptions_ExportTo2DPdfFromInspection
Member.Description: 2048 or 0x800; Export drawing sheets from Inspection to 2DPdf

Member.Name: swSaveAsOptions_IgnoreBiography
Member.Description: 256 or 0x100; Prune a SOLIDWORKS file's revision history to just the current file name

Member.Name: swSaveAsOptions_IncludeVirtualSubAsmComps
Member.Description: 1024 or 0x400; Save regular components in virtual subassemblies

Member.Name: swSaveAsOptions_OverrideSaveEmodel
Member.Description: 32 or 0x20; Saves eDrawings-related information into a section of the file being saved; specifying this setting overrides the Tools, Options, System Options, General, Save eDrawings data in SOLIDWORKS document setting; not a valid option for <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPartDoc.SaveToFile2">IPartDoc::SaveToFile2</see>

Member.Name: swSaveAsOptions_PropagateVisualProperties
Member.Description: 4096 or 0x1000; Export drawing sheets from Inspection to 2DPdf

Member.Name: swSaveAsOptions_SaveReferenced
Member.Description: 4 or 0x4; Supports parts, assemblies, and drawings; this setting indicates to save all components (sub-assemblies and parts) in both assemblies and drawings; if a part has an external reference, then this setting indicates to save the external reference

Member.Name: swSaveAsOptions_UpdateInactiveViews
Member.Description: 16 or 0x10; Not a valid option for <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPartDoc.SaveToFile2">IPartDoc::SaveToFile2</see>; this setting is only applicable for a drawing that has one or more sheets; this setting updates the views on inactive sheets

Type.Name: swSaveAsVersion_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Version of a particular format to save the document.

Member.Name: swSaveAsCurrentVersion
Member.Description: 0 = This is the typical save behavior.

Type.Name: swSaveAsmAsPartOptions_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Save assembly as parts options.

Type.Name: swSaveItemsPathError_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Error return codes for <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAdvancedSaveAsOptions.ModifyItemsNameAndPath">IAdvancedSaveAsOptions::ModifyItemsNameAndPath</see>.

Member.Name: swSaveItemsPathError_ArraySizeNotMatching
Member.Description: 1 = Input arrays must be the same size

Member.Name: swSaveItemsPathError_InvalidPath
Member.Description: 2 = Path provided does not exist or user does not have write access

Member.Name: swSaveItemsPathError_WrongComponentName
Member.Description: 3 = Name provided is not supported by SOLIDWORKS

Type.Name: swSaveReminderIntervalMode_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Intervals in which to remind user to save document.

Type.Name: swSaveRestoreSettingsResults_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Return values for saving and restoring SOLIDWORKS settings.

Type.Name: swSaveWithReferencesOptions_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Options for saving references while getting the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAdvancedSaveAsOptions">IAdvancedSaveAsOptions</see> object; used by the Options parameter of <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.GetAdvancedSaveAsOptions">IModelDocExtension::GetAdvancedSaveAsOptions</see>. <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/bitmasks.htm">Bitmask</see>.

Member.Name: swSaveWithReferencesOptions_IncludeBrokenReferences
Member.Description: 4 = Reference list contains both normal references and components with broken references

Member.Name: swSaveWithReferencesOptions_IncludeToolBoxParts
Member.Description: 2 = Reference list contains both normal and ToolBox references

Member.Name: swSaveWithReferencesOptions_IncludeVirtualComponents
Member.Description: 1 = Reference list contains both normal and virtual component references

Member.Name: swSaveWithReferencesOptions_None
Member.Description: 0 = Reference list contains only normal references

Member.Name: swSketchCheckFeatureStatus_MoreThanOneContour

Member.Name: swSketchCheckFeatureStatus_NoOpen

Type.Name: swSketchTrimChoice_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Sketch trim options.

Member.Name: swSketchTrimClosest
Member.Description: 0 = Trim to closest. One and only one sketch segment must be selected before calling <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISketchManager.SketchTrim">ISketchManager::SketchTrim</see> using this option.

Member.Name: swSketchTrimCorner
Member.Description: 1 = Corner. Two and only two sketch segments must be selected before calling ISketchManager::SketchTrim using this option.

Member.Name: swSketchTrimEntities
Member.Description: 4 = Power trim. Before calling ISketchManager::SketchTrim using this option, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2</see> with Mark = 2 to select 1 or more sketch segments (up to total number of sketch segments in the model), specifying their pick points. The sketch segments are trimmed to the sketch segments nearest their pick points. When you trim sketch segments using Power trim in the user interface, you drag your cursor across sketch segments, and the point at which the cursor crosses a sketch segment is where that sketch segment is trimmed. The API simulates this functionality by requiring you to select sketch segments by pick points, which are used as references when trimming the selected sketch segments.

Member.Name: swSketchTrimEntityPoint
Member.Description: 3 = Power trim. One and only one sketch segment must be selected before calling ISketchManager::SketchTrim using this option. Trims to a specific point on the sketch segment. Call this method, specifying non-zero X, Y, and Z, the point at which to trim the selected sketch segment. The specified point must lie on the sketch segment.

Member.Name: swSketchTrimInside
Member.Description: 6 = Trim away inside. Before calling ISketchManager::SketchTrim using this option, select at least three sketch segments: two to create the boundary, and one or more that intersect both sketch segments in the boundary. All selected sketch segments that intersect the boundary are trimmed inside the boundary segments.

Member.Name: swSketchTrimOutside
Member.Description: 5 = Trim away outside. Before calling ISketchManager::SketchTrim using this option, select at least three sketch segments: two to create the trim boundary, and one or more that intersect both sketch segments in the boundary. All selected sketch segments that intersect the boundary are trimmed outside the boundary segments.

Member.Name: swSketchTrimTwoEntities
Member.Description: 2 = Power trim. Before calling ISketchManager::SketchTrim using this option, use IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2 with Mark = 0 to select two intersecting sketch segments, specifying their pick points. Trims the first selected sketch segment to the second intersecting sketch segment. The order in which the sketch segments are selected determines which one is trimmed. The first selected sketch segment will be trimmed on its pick point side to the second selected sketch segment.

Type.Name: swSlicingTypes_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Types of slicing. <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/bitmasks.htm">Bitmask</see>.

Member.Name: swSlicingTypes_Circle
Member.Description: 4 = Creates a circle whose diameter equals the average of the length and width of the rectangle that encloses all the sketch entities; circle is located at the intersection of the source geometry and the slicing plane

Member.Name: swSlicingTypes_Exact
Member.Description: 2 = Creates an exact intersection of the mesh BREP body and graphics body resulting in a polyline; set only if swSlicingTypes_Intersection is also set; not valid with swSlicingTypes_Circle and swSlicingTypes_Rectangle

Member.Name: swSlicingTypes_Intersection
Member.Description: 1 = For SOLIDWORKS BREP geometry, the slicing is identical to what is generated using the Intersection Curve tool; for mesh BREP and graphics bodies, sketches generated cannot be modified

Member.Name: swSlicingTypes_Rectangle
Member.Description: 8 = Creates a rectangle that encloses all the sketch entities and is located at the intersection of the source geometry and the slicing plane

Type.Name: swSlotMateConstraintOptions_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Slot mate constraint options.

Member.Name: swSlotMateConstraintOption_Centered
Member.Description: 1 = Center the component in the slot

Member.Name: swSlotMateConstraintOption_Distance
Member.Description: 2 = Place the component axis at a specified distance from the end of the slot

Member.Name: swSlotMateConstraintOption_Free
Member.Description: 0 = Allow the component to move freely in the slot

Member.Name: swSlotMateConstraintOption_Percent
Member.Description: 3 = Place the component axis at a specified percent of slot length distance from the end of the slot

Type.Name: swSmartComponentSelectionTypes_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Smart component selection types.

Type.Name: swSmartDimensionDirection_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Smart dimension extension line directions or rapid dimensioning selector quadrants.
Type.Remarks: RemarksIn parts, this enumerator is used to specify the extension line that is needed to unambiguously define the angle to dimension. In the user interface, a direction manipulator appears during dimensioning if selected entities do not fully specify the angle to dimension. This enumerator specifies the directions of that manipulator. In drawings that have Rapid dimensioning turned on, this enumerator may be used to specify the quadrant or side of the entities to which to add the display dimension.See <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.AddDimension">IModelDocExtension::AddDimension</see>.

Type.Name: swSolidBodiesDescriptionPropertyIndex Enumeration
Type.Description: Arguments in the text expression of the Description bounding box property.
Type.Remarks: RemarksThis enumerator corresponds to dropdowns displayed under Tools > Options > Document Properties > Weldments > Bounding Box Properties > Solid Bodies Description.

Type.Name: swSolidworksWeldmentEndCondOptions_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Weldment end condition options.

Type.Description: Tangency options for lofts and profile twist options for sweeps.

Member.Name: swMinimumTwist
Member.Description: 10 = Prevents the profile from becoming self-intersecting as it follows the sweep or loft path; valid only for 3D paths; corresponds to Profile Twist > Minimum Twist in the Sweep PropertyManager

Member.Name: swTangencyAllFaces
Member.Description: 3 = Makes the adjacent faces tangent at the profile; valid only if <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swconst.swTwistControlType_e">swTwistControlType_e</see> is set to swTwistControlFollowPath and only when attaching a sweep or loft to existing geometry; corresponds to Profile Twist > Tangent to Adjacent Faces in the Sweep PropertyManager

Member.Name: swTangencyDirectionVector
Member.Description: 2 = Sets a direction plane, planar face, line, edge, cylinder, axis, or a pair of vertices; valid only if <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swconst.swTwistControlType_e">swTwistControlType_e</see> is set to swTwistControlFollowPath; corresponds to Profile Twist > Specify Direction Vector in the Sweep PropertyManager

Member.Name: swTangencyNormalToProfile
Member.Description: 1 = Aligns the profile normal to the sweep or loft path; valid only for 2D paths; corresponds to Profile Twist > None in the Sweep PropertyManager

Type.Name: swTaskPaneNotify_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Task Pane notifications.
Type.Remarks: RemarksTo receive notifications, a DLL application must register for the notifications by object type. This registration must be done for each instance of a particular object. For example, in the file in the Visual C++ 6.0 wizard-generated add-in that supports Task Pane events (e.g., Taskpane.h, include: DECLARE_REGISTRY_RESOURCEID(IDR_TaskPane) BEGIN_SINK_MAP(CTaskPane) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_TASKPANE_EVENTS, DIID_DTaskpaneViewEvents, swAppTaskPaneDestroyNotify, DestroyNotify) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_TASKPANE_EVENTS, DIID_DTaskpaneViewEvents, swAppTaskPaneActivateNotify, ActivateNotify) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_TASKPANE_EVENTS, DIID_DTaskpaneViewEvents, swAppTaskPaneDeactivateNotify, DeActivateNotify) END_SINK_MAP() If developing a C++ application, use these enumerators to <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/events.htm">register for notifications</see> for the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ITaskpaneView">ITaskpaneView</see> events.

Type.Name: swTwistControlType_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Sweep twist control options.

Member.Name: swTwistControlConstantTwistAlongPath
Member.Description: 8 = Defines the twist of the profile along the sweep path; corresponds to Profile Twist > Specify Twist Value in the Sweep PropertyManager

Member.Name: swTwistControlFollowFirstSecondGuideCurves
Member.Description: 3 = The twist of the intermediate sections is determined by the vector from the first guide cruve to the second guide curve; the angle between the horizontal plane and the vector remains constant in the sketch planes of all of the intermediate sections; corresponds to Profile Twist > Follow First and Second Guide Curves in the Sweep PropertyManager (only valid if two guide curves are present)

Member.Name: swTwistControlFollowPath
Member.Description: 0 = Corresponds to Profile orientation > Follow Path in the Sweep PropertyManager; after specifying this option, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISweepFeatureData.PathAlignmentType">ISweepFeatureData::PathAlignmentType</see> to specify path alignment options as defined in <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swconst.swTangencyType_e">swTangencyType_e</see>

Member.Name: swTwistControlFollowPathFirstGuideCurve
Member.Description: 2 = The twist of the intermediate sections is determined by the vector from the path to the first guide curve; the angle between the horizontal plane and the vector remains constant in the sketch planes of all of the intermediate sections; corresponds to Profile Twist > Follow Path and First Guide Curve in the Sweep PropertyManager (only valid if at least one guide curve is present)

Member.Name: swTwistControlKeepNormalConstant
Member.Description: 1 = Twists the section along the sweep path, keeping the section parallel to the beginning section as it twists along the path; corresponds to Profile orientation > Keep Normal Constant in the Sweep PropertyManager

Member.Name: swTwistControlNormalConstantTwistAlongPath
Member.Description: 9 = Defines the twist of the profile along the sweep path, keeping the section parallel to the beginning section as it twists along the path; corresponds to Profile orientation > Keep Normal Constant and Profile Twist > Specify Twist Value in the Sweep PropertyManager

Type.Remarks:
RemarksUse with:
<see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.GetUserPreferenceDouble">IModelDocExtension::GetUserPreferenceDouble</see> and <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SetUserPreferenceDouble">IModelDocExtension::SetUserPreferenceDouble</see> <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.GetUserPreferenceInteger">IModelDocExtension::GetUserPreferenceInteger</see> and <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SetUserPreferenceInteger">IModelDocExtension::SetUserPreferenceInteger</see> <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.GetUserPreferenceString">IModelDocExtension::GetUserPreferenceString</see> and <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SetUserPreferenceString">IModelDocExtension::SetUserPreferenceString</see> <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.GetUserPreferenceTextFormat">IModelDocExtension::GetUserPreferenceTextFormat</see> and <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SetUserPreferenceTextFormat">IModelDocExtension::SetUserPreferenceTextFormat</see> <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.GetUserPreferenceToggle">IModelDocExtension::GetUserPreferenceToggle</see> and <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SetUserPreferenceToggle">IModelDocExtension::SetUserPreferenceToggle</see>

Member.Name: swDxfMappingFiles
Member.Description: 0 = This setting is persistent across SOLIDWORKS sessions; you can also interactively get or set the custom map file setting by clicking File, Save As, .dxf or .dwg as Save as type, and Options; separate each string in the list by a line feed (e.g., the vbLf constant in Visual Basic).

Type.Name: swViewNotify_e Enumeration
Type.Description: Model view notifications.
Type.Remarks:
RemarksTo receive notifications, a DLL application must register for the notifications by object type. This registration must be done for each instance of a particular object. For example, in the file in the Visual C++ 6.0 wizard-generated add-in that supports model view events (e.g., DocView.h), include:
BEGIN_SINK_MAP(CDocView) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_MODELVIEW_EVENTS, DIID_DModelViewEvents, swViewDestroyNotify, DestroyNotify) SINK_ENTRY_EX(ID_MODELVIEW_EVENTS, DIID_DModelViewEvents, swViewRepaintNotify, RepaintNotify) END_SINK_MAP()
If developing a C++ application, use these enumerators to <see href="https://help.solidworks.com/2026/english/api/sldworksapiprogguide/overview/events.htm">register for notifications</see> for the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelView">IModelView</see> events.

Type.Remarks:
Remarks swStandardSuperiorBottomingTappedHole2249 = Superior - Tapped hole swStandardSuperiorEjectorPinClearances239 = Superior - Hole swStandardSuperiorEjectorPins223 = Superior - Counterbore hole swStandardSuperiorFlatHead100229 = Superior - Countersink hole swStandardSuperiorFlatHead82230 = Superior - Countersink hole swStandardSuperiorFlatSocket82232 = Superior - Countersink hole swStandardSuperiorFractionalDrillSizes234 = Superior - Hole swStandardSuperiorHcoilTapDrills233 = Superior - Hole swStandardSuperiorLeaderPinClearances242 = Superior - Hole swStandardSuperiorLetterDrillSizes240 = Superior - Hole swStandardSuperiorNumberDrillSizes235 = Superior - Hole swStandardSuperiorOval231 = Superior - Countersink hole swStandardSuperiorPipeTapDrills236 = Superior - Hole swStandardSuperiorReturnPinClearances244 = Superior - Hole swStandardSuperiorReturnPins222 = Superior - Counterbore hole swStandardSuperiorScrewClearances237 = Superior - Hole swStandardSuperiorSocketCapScrew227 = Superior - Counterbore hole swStandardSuperiorSpruePullerPinClearances243 = Superior - Hole swStandardSuperiorSpruePullerPins224 = Superior - Counterbore hole swStandardSuperiorStandardLeaderPins228 = Superior - Counterbore hole swStandardSuperiorStripperBolt226 = Superior - Counterbore hole swStandardSuperiorSupportPillarClearances241 = Superior - Hole swStandardSuperiorSupportPillarSHCS225 = Superior - Counterbore hole swStandardSuperiorTapDrills245 = Superior - Hole swStandardSuperiorTaperedPipeTap248 = Superior - Piped tapped hole swStandardSuperiorTappedHoleObsolete; see Remarks swStandardSuperiorTappedHole2247 = Superior - Tapped hole
RemarksIf you used the now obsolete swStandardSuperiorTappedHole or swStandardSuperiorBottomingTappedHole enumerations with <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.HoleWizard2">IFeatureManager::HoleWizard2</see> or <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IWizardHoleFeatureData2.FastenerType2">IWizardHoleFeatureData2::FastenerType2</see>, then switch to using swStandardSuperiorTappedHole2 or swStandardSuperiorBottomingTappedHole2. If you recorded a macro, then the correct values may already be in use.
